race_cath_desc: The Cath are a feline race who are typically lazy. They are curious and love exploring the unknown. However, most Cath prefer to laze about rather than work hard.
race_wolven_desc: The Wolven are a canine race who usually move in organized packs. They are a highly social species and rarely undertake any task alone.
race_rabbit_desc: The Bunny are a hopping race of super-active lagomorphs. They multiply quickly and are hyperactive.
race_vulpine_desc: The %0 are a playful species of %1 fox. They are cunning and have a bushy tail.
race_chocolate_rabbit_desc: Chocolate Bunnies are so tasty that they engage in cannibalism. In a bunny eat bunny world you need to be ruthless to survive.
race_centaur_desc: Centaur are a species of horse creatures who have human-like upper bodies. They are fast-moving and strong.
race_reindeer_desc: The Reindeer are highly evolved herd animals. They are champion sled pullers and can haul huge loads of gifts.
race_rhinotaur_desc: Rhinotaur are tough, bestial creatures who have a large horn attached to their nose.
race_capybara_desc: The Capybara are highly-evolved giant rodents. They have sharp teeth that grow constantly and require grinding.
race_donkey_desc: The Donkey are highly resilent beasts adept to climbing mountains. They move through terrain too tough for reindeer.
race_bearkin_desc: The Bearkin are a race of bipedal ursine.
race_porkenari_desc: The Porkenari are an evolved warthog.
race_hedgeoken_desc: The Hedgeoken are a species decended from hedgehogs. They are covered in spines and can roll up into a spiky ball.
race_kobold_desc: Kobolds are small humanoid creatures who are known for their infatuation with candles. They are adept at hoarding as much stuff as possible.
race_goblin_desc: Goblins are small humanoid creatures who are known for their greed and cunning. They are highly intelligent but typically selfish in nature.
race_gnome_desc: Gnomes are small humanoid creatures who are known for their superior intelligence. They are natural scientists and seek to expand their knowledge, often at the cost of safety and morality.
race_ogre_desc: Ogres are large humanoid creatures who are known for being kind of dumb. They are very strong, with few races being able to match their physical prowess. However, they learn slowly.
race_cyclops_desc: Cyclops are large humanoid creatures who have a single giant eye. They have poor depth perception but are fairly social and intelligent.
race_troll_desc: Trolls are large humanoid creatures who are known for their regenerative powers. They are a hardy race highly resistant to disease and injury.
race_tortoisan_desc: Tortoisans are a reptilian species with %0 shells on their backs. They are slow-moving and good at hiding.
race_ninja_turtle_desc: Ninja turtles are a species of %0 shelled martial artist turtles that love pizza.
race_gecko_desc: The Geckos are a lizard species who can naturally camouflage themselves to their surroundings. They are very agile and fast-moving.
race_slitheryn_desc: Slitheryn are a reptilian species who evolved from snakes. They have humanoid upper bodies but retain snake-like lower halves.
race_arraak_desc: Arraak are a species of feathered birds. Modern Arraak aren't as adept at flying as their ancestors, but they can still glide.
race_turkey_desc: Turkey are a species of feathered birds. They taste great with gravy and a side of mashed potatoes.
race_pterodacti_desc: Pterodacti are descended from large, featherless flying creatures. Their skin is leathery and they have long, narrow heads.
race_dracnid_desc: Dracnid are descended from large, scaly flying creatures. They are tough due to their natural armor, but they tend to be antisocial and greedy.
race_entish_desc: Ents are basically sentient trees who can uproot themselves and move around. They are large and slow-moving, but fearsome and can get most of their nutrients from the sun.
race_spruce_desc: Spruce Ents are a special festive breed of ents who love to show off with decorations.
race_cacti_desc: Cacti are small sentient plant creatures covered in spines. They are surprisingly fast-moving, but easily startled.
race_pinguicula_desc: The Pinguicula are a plant-based species who are covered in a sticky film used to trap small prey. They are well suited to nutrient-poor environments.
race_sporgar_desc: Sporgar are a parasitic species of sentient mold spores that spread by infecting host bodies and possessing them.
race_shroomi_desc: The Shroomi are a race of mushroom-like creatures. They prefer dark places away from sunlight.
race_moldling_desc: The Moldling are a race of blob-like creatures made of a mass of mold which can shape itself into any form they please.
race_mantis_desc: Mantis are an insectoid species that resemble giant... mantis. They are quick but fragile.
race_scorpid_desc: Scorpid are a bipedal species with large claw hands and barbed tails. They are tough fighters naturally equipped for close combat.
race_antid_desc: Antid are a hivemind species descended from ants. Individually they are not intelligent, but as their swarm increases so does their collective intelligence.
race_sharkin_desc: Sharkin are an aquatic species descended from aggressive fish that have large mouths with many sharp teeth. Although they can roam on land, they prefer to stay underwater.
race_octigoran_desc: Octigoran are an aquatic species of cephalopod who have eight tentacles. They can mimic walking on land using their appendages as makeshift legs, but are most at home underwater.
race_dryad_desc: Dryads are forest creatures that are deeply connected to their trees. They can be quite ruthless if anyone threatens their trees.
race_satyr_desc: Satyrs are whimsical goat men that prefer to party rather than work. They are like a society of frat boys.
race_phoenix_desc: Phoenixes are avians that constantly emanate heat. When they die, they can sometimes self-resurrect in an explosion of fire.
race_salamander_desc: Salamanders are descended from lizards who evolved around lava flows. They can exhale intense flames and are not to be trifled with.
race_yeti_desc: Yeti are polar apes that dislike hot locations. For some reason, pictures of them are always blurry.
race_snowman_desc: Snowmen are animated piles of snow that appear in humanoid shapes.
race_wendigo_desc: Wendigos are horrific creatures that were born in the coldest climates. They have ravenous appetites which are never sated, and they feed only on the souls of other creatures.
race_krampus_desc: Krampus are horrific creatures that torment children who misbehave. They have ravenous appetites which are never sated, and they feed on the souls of those on the naughty list.
race_tuskin_desc: Tuskin evolved in the deserts and are normally hostile to anyone who is not part of their clan. They will often attack strangers for any resources they might provide.
race_kamel_desc: The Kamel are a race of humanoids with a giant hump on their back. They can go for long periods of time without drinking water.
race_balorg_desc: Balorg are a fiery race of demons who inhabit the abyss. Their skin literally burns with hellfire and few who gaze upon them live to tell the tale.
race_imp_desc: Imps are a small race of demonic creatures who delight in tormenting their victims with pranks that are far from harmless.
race_seraph_desc: Seraph are a race of angelic beings who inhabit the mountains of Eden. Although they champion the light, they won't hesitate to smite evil wherever it is found.
race_cherub_desc: Cherub are cute little chubby angelic beings. Although they resemble babies with wings, they won't hesitate to shoot you with an arrow through the heart.
race_unicorn_desc: Unicorns are mythical creatures of the light who roam the plains of Eden. Despite their reputation for good, unicorns are quite vicious when challenged.
race_emocorn_desc: The Emocorn have traded in the bright and cheery life of the unicorns for a dark and broody existence.
race_synth_desc: Synths are androids that have been covered in organic flesh to look just like their creator race. To an outside observer they appear indistinguishable from fully organic %0.
race_nano_desc: The Nano are swarms of tiny robots that work together to form larger entities. Each nano citizen is made up of trillions of individual nanites.
race_ghast_desc: The Ghast are a species of nightmarish dark-dwelling creatures that are fast, strong, and cannibalistic.
race_shoggoth_desc: Shoggoth are sentient amoeba-like blobs of flesh that can sprout eyes, mouths, and pseudopodia anywhere on their body at will.
race_dwarf_desc: Dwarves are short stocky humanoids known for their beards and love of alcohol.
race_raccoon_desc: Racconar are a species of highly evolved raccoons that love to tinker and have a habit of kleptomania.
race_lichen_desc: Lichen are a symbiotic creature that evolved as a strange blend of plant and fungi that blend together to make a single bush like creature.
race_wyvern_desc: Wyvern are a ferocious species of flying reptiles.
race_beholder_desc: Behodlers are deadly giant floating eyeballs that dominate everything around them. They also love hoodies.
race_djinn_desc: Djinn are mystical creatures that are rumored to be able to grant wishes.
race_narwhal_desc: The Narwhalus are large mono-tusked creatures that evolved in the arctic regions. They are descendant from whales and have a single large tusk.
race_penguin_desc: The Pengino are large flightless birds that prefer to live in cold or moist environments.
race_bombardier_desc: The Bombardier are descended from beetles and can spit literal fireballs at anyone who challenges them.
race_nephilim_desc: Nephilim are descendants of an unholy union beween celestial and demonic beings.
race_junker_desc: The Valdi are a genetic disaster; it's a wonder they have survived this long.
race_ghoul_desc: Draugrs come out to play when the barrier to the spirit world is weak.
race_sludge_desc: The Sludge are a pathetic genetic disaster of ooze made self aware; it's a wonder they can function at all.
race_ultra_sludge_desc: The Ultra Sludge are a repulsive genetic disaster of ooze made self aware; it's pretty bad, really just terrible, the worst.
trait_adaptable: Your race is more easily modified by gene therapy.
trait_wasteful: Your race is wasteful and uses extra materials to craft things.
trait_xenophobic: Your race's dislike of foreigners reduces the number of trade routes they can operate.
trait_beast: Your bestial instincts improve your hunting skills and make training soldiers easier.
trait_cautious: Your race is less effective at combat when it is precipitating.
trait_forager: Your race are experts at foraging for resources.
trait_small: Your race is small and thus requires less materials to build things.
trait_weak: Your race is ineffective at tough manual labor.
trait_drunk: Your race is inebriated most of the time and less effective at tough manual labor jobs.
trait_large: Your race is large and thus requires extra materials to build things.
trait_strong: Your race has great strength and can do menial labor jobs much faster.
trait_cold_blooded: Your species is sensitive to the outside temperature.
trait_scales: Your species is protected by scales that act as a kind of natural armor.
trait_flier: Your species can fly and prefers to use lightweight clay-based materials for construction.
trait_hollow_bones: Your species has lightweight bones and requires less crafted material to build structures.
trait_sky_lover: Your species feels most at peace under open skies and greatly dislikes working underground.
trait_rigid: Your race has a stiff skeletal structure and crafts less efficiently.
trait_high_pop: Your species grows to large numbers, for better or worse.
trait_fast_growth: Your species gestates quickly, so its population raises faster than other species.
trait_high_metabolism: Your species metabolizes food quickly. As a result, you need more of it.
trait_photosynth: Your race produces part of its food requirements through photosynthesis.
trait_sappy: Your people naturally produce sap, which can be hardened into a useful building material called %0.
trait_asymmetrical: Your species is asymmetrical. This gives you a more monstrous appearance, making trade more difficult.
trait_spores: Your species propagates quickly when it's windy.
trait_detritivore: You consume dead matter for nutrition.
trait_spongy: Your species doesn't propagate when it's precipitating.
trait_elusive: Your spies rarely, if ever, get caught.
trait_iron_allergy: Iron is toxic to you. It must be handled with care, thus making mining and refining it slower.
trait_smoldering: You revel in hot weather, gaining increasing production the longer it lasts.
trait_cold_intolerance: You despise cold weather, losing increasing production the longer it lasts.
trait_chilled: You revel in cold weather, gaining increasing production the longer it lasts.
trait_heat_intolerance: You despise hot weather, losing increasing production the longer it lasts.
trait_scavenger: You can assign scavengers to look for useful items which boost productivity.
trait_nomadic: Your nomadic lifestyle makes established trade more difficult.
trait_submerged: Your species lives primarily underwater and is thus not affected by most weather.
trait_low_light: Sunlight does not penetrate into the depths of the ocean easily, and farming activities are less effective as a result.
trait_creative: Your species's natural creativity leads to faster development of super projects.
trait_diverse: The diverse nature of your species makes working together as a cohesive military unit more difficult.
trait_studious: Your race is more focused when studying than average. Knowledge is gained faster as a result.
trait_arrogant: The inherent arrogance of your species often leads to you overpaying in negotiations.
trait_brute: Your race loves fighting and is easier to recruit for battle.
trait_angry: Your race is quick to get angry when hungry.
trait_lazy: Your race loves nothing more than a lazy afternoon. Productivity is lost in warm weather as a result.
trait_curious: Your race has to know what's behind every closed door. This thirst for knowledge boosts University effectiveness but often gets citizens into trouble.
trait_carnivore: Your species is carnivorous and does not engage in agriculture.
trait_pack_mentality: Your race prefers to live in groups.
trait_tracker: Your race excels at tracking game, and thus produces more from hunting.
trait_playful: Your hunters are happy playing in the wild.
trait_freespirit: Those forced to conform and hold modern jobs are less happy.
trait_beast_of_burden: Your race is able to carry away more loot when winning a military conflict.
trait_sniper: Your mastery of ranged weaponry makes new weapons more impactful.
trait_hooved: You require manufacturing special shoes to expand your population.
trait_hooved_slime: You require manufacturing special containers to expand your population.
trait_hooved_cath: You require boxes to expand your population.
trait_hooved_wolven: You require chew toys to expand your population.
trait_hooved_dracnid: You require decoy hoards to expand your population.
trait_hooved_seraph: You require halos to expand your population.
trait_hooved_cyclops: You require monocles to expand your population.
trait_hooved_kobold: You require candles to expand your population.
trait_hooved_tuskin: You require goggles to expand your population.
trait_hooved_sharkin: Your new citizens require tooth sharpeners to keep their teeth sharp.
trait_hooved_beholder: Your new citizens require a special lens to focus their eye.
trait_hooved_djinn: You require a special resting place to expand your population.
trait_hooved_humanoid: You require sandals to expand your population.
trait_hooved_avian: You require perches to expand your population.
trait_hooved_plant: You require pots to expand your population.
trait_hooved_fungi: You require damp cloth to expand your population.
trait_hooved_reptilian: You require heat rocks to expand your population.
trait_hooved_fey: You require pixie dust to expand your population.
trait_hooved_synthetic: You require batteries to expand your population.
trait_rage: When wounded, your kind rage with power.
trait_heavy: Your heavy weight requires extra materials to support.
trait_gnawer: Your race requires constant gnawing to keep your teeth filed.
trait_calm: Your people are very calm, rarely getting agitated by anything.
trait_herbivore: Your species does not eat meat.
trait_instinct: Your highly-toned instincts help you avoid danger.
trait_pack_rat: Your species is adept at packing the most stuff into any storage space.
trait_paranoid: Your race is paranoid and doesn't trust banks.
trait_greedy: Your race is greedy and will not willingly part with money, reducing income from taxes.
trait_merchant: Your race has an innate gift for haggling.
trait_smart: Your race more easily understands new concepts.
trait_puny: Your race is less effective in combat.
trait_dumb: Your race does not easily understand new concepts.
trait_tough: Your race is tough and can withstand the most gruelling jobs without succumbing to weakness.
trait_nearsighted: Your species is nearsighted and requires bigger font sizes to read.
trait_intelligent: Your species always leverages the latest advancements in science to its full benefit.
trait_gluttony: Your species is always hungry and eats extra food.
trait_slow: Your species is slow moving and rarely in a hurry to get anything done.
trait_armored: Your race is naturally armored and thus less likely to be fatally wounded in battle.
trait_optimistic: Your race always tries to look for the best possible outcome.
trait_chameleon: Your species's natural affinity for hiding has caused them to be more averse to having a standing army.
trait_slow_digestion: Your race digests food slowly and thus will not starve as easily.
trait_hard_of_hearing: Your species has poor hearing and thus lectures are less effective.
trait_resourceful: Your species's resourcefulness leads to less waste when crafting.
trait_leathery: Your race has leathery skin, which makes them more weather resistant.
trait_hoarder: Your race loves to hoard money.
trait_solitary: Your race prefers to live alone rather than with others.
trait_kindling_kindred: Your race is averse to cutting down trees for lumber. All lumber costs are removed, but other costs are increased.
trait_pyrophobia: Your race is afraid of fire and smelters operate slower as a result
trait_hyper: Your race can never sit still and is always doing something.
trait_skittish: Your race is easily startled and may lose productivity when scared.
trait_fragrant: You give off a strong odor, which while not unpleasant makes hunting harder.
trait_sticky: Your sticky body traps prey, reducing food requirements and giving you an edge in combat.
trait_infectious: Your race spreads by infecting other creatures and taking over the host body.
trait_parasite: Your species is a parasite and must infect host victims to grow.
trait_toxic: Your species's natural toxicity makes them resistant to toxic workplaces and thus they are more productive in factories.
trait_nyctophilia: Your race does not like direct sunlight, so they are less productive when it's sunny.
trait_infiltrator: You are the ultimate infiltrator, able to break into any secure location and steal valuable secrets.
trait_infiltrator_steal: You have stolen the knowledge of %0 from a rival nation.
trait_infiltrator_steal_alt: You have stolen the knowledge of %0 from a reclusive scientist.
trait_infiltrator_thrall: Your thralls have stolen knowledge of %0 from the surface dwellers.
trait_infiltrator_thrall_alt: Your thralls have stolen knowledge of %0 from a reclusive scientist.
trait_hibernator: Your species lowers their metabolic rate during the winter, consuming less energy but also being far less productive.
trait_cannibalize: You are cannibals and will eat your own kind. Gain the strength of your own by ingesting them.
trait_frail: Your race is frail and is more likely to die in combat.
trait_malnutrition: Your race can function while suffering from malnutrition better than most.
trait_claws: Your race is more effective in combat.
trait_atrophy: Your race atrophies quicker when not well-fed.
trait_hivemind: Your citizens are highly ineffectual when working as individuals, but gain potency as they work in bigger groups.
trait_tunneler: Your species is naturally adept at digging tunnels, which makes mine shafts cheaper to produce.
trait_blood_thirst: The scent of blood sends your troops into a frenzy, increasing your morale temporarily. You are also immune to the warmonger penalty.
trait_apex_predator: You are a very dangerous predator. Hunting and combat effectiveness is increased, but armor technology is unusable.
trait_invertebrate: Your lack of a skeletal structure means you can't haul away as much loot from battle.
trait_suction_grip: Your superior grip boosts all productivity.
trait_befuddle: Your natural guile helps you complete spy actions quicker.
trait_environmentalist: You seek balance with nature above all other things.
trait_unorganized: It takes longer to organize a revolution.
trait_musical: Entertainers are more effective at keeping the masses happy.
trait_revive: Your soldiers can sometimes revive after being killed. It is much more likely to occur in hot climates.
trait_slow_regen: Your soldiers wounds heal at a reduced rate.
trait_forge: Your ability to breathe fire removes the fuel requirement to operate smelters.
trait_autoignition: Your core body temperature causes paper to combust near you, reducing the knowledge bonus from libraries.
trait_blurry: For some reason no one can ever get a good look at you. Spies are less likely to be caught during espionage actions.
trait_snowy: Your race loves snow so much that they become depressed when there is no snow.
trait_ravenous: You are always starving and consume everything available.
trait_ghostly: Your connection to the ethereal helps attract souls.
trait_lawless: Your disrespect for central authority lets you change government much more frequently.
trait_mistrustful: Conflicts cause you to lose reputation with rival cities faster.
trait_humpback: You can go longer periods of time without eating and can haul more basic materials from worksites.
trait_thalassophobia: You dislike large bodies of water and will not invest in developing the sea.
trait_immoral: Your race is immoral and delights in conflict.
trait_fiery: Your skin burns with unholy fire, making you one of the most feared opponents on the battlefield.
trait_terrifying: You are so terrifying that no one will trade with you.
trait_slaver: You use anyone you can capture as forced labor, often working them to death.
trait_compact: You are very small, and thus do not need many materials to construct things.
trait_pathetic: You are pathetic in combat; the other demons view you as vermin.
trait_conniving: Your conniving ways get you the best deals in trades.
trait_blissful: Your citizens exist in a state of bliss; it takes a lot to make them upset.
trait_pompous: The pompous attitude of your species hinders academic pursuits. Professors are significantly less effective.
trait_holy: You are filled with holy energy, which helps you smite evil creatures.
trait_unified: Your race is united and does not war amongst themselves.
trait_spiritual: Your spirituality increases the effectiveness of temples.
trait_manipulator: Your masterful manipulation increases the effectiveness of propaganda centers.
trait_truthful: You are incapable of lying. This makes you inherently bad at some professions.
trait_rainbow: Whenever rainbows appear you get a significant productivity boost.
trait_gloomy: You are dark and broody all the time. You love dark and depressing places.
trait_magnificent: You are a magnificent creature of the light. Seekers of the light will often leave you tribute at shrines dedicated to your magnificence.
trait_noble: Your noble race is immune to corruption and will not implement extreme tax strategies.
trait_artifical: You are an artificial lifeform. Additional units must be constructed; population does not grow naturally.
trait_powered: You require electricity to keep operational.
trait_imitation: You are an imitation of another species; you have weaker versions of their attributes as a result.
trait_emotionless: You have no emotions; cold logic dictates your decisions.
trait_logical: Your citizens contribute directly to your knowledge cap.
trait_shapeshifter: You can assume the properties of another genus.
trait_deconstructor: You destroy matter to reorder it for your own purposes.
trait_linked: Your citizens are all linked together, which grants you extra computational power.
trait_psychic: Your species has powerful psychic abilities.
trait_tormented: Suffering is so routine for your kind that positive morale is an abstract concept.
trait_darkness: Planets you inhabit strangely have less sunlight.
trait_unfathomable: Other species are completely unable to comprehend your motives and society.
trait_dark_dweller: Your species hates light and dwells in total darkness.
trait_swift: Your species is swift, agile, and deadly.
trait_anthropophagite: Your people won't hesitate to eat each other if food runs low.
trait_living_tool: You are able to morph your body to create basic tools.
trait_bloated: You have a lot of mass.
trait_rogue: You have sticky fingers, randomly stealing things.
trait_untrustworthy: Financial institutions cost more to protect themselves from you.
trait_living_materials: You use materials for contruction that are alive.
trait_unstable: Your species is an unstable mixture of organic components and sometimes dies spontaneously.
trait_elemental: You have an elemental affinity depending on your starting environment.
trait_chicken: You apparently taste like chicken, and other creatures find you delicious to eat. You will experience increased aggression as they crave your meat.
trait_blubber: Your body is rich in blubber.
trait_ocular_power: You have a big magical eye.
trait_floating: You float in the air, and thus are easy to knock around.
trait_devious: People are well aware of your reputation for being devious and are hesitant to make deals with you.
trait_grenadier: You have less soldiers, but they are a lot more powerful.
trait_aggressive: Your people are aggressive and get into a lot of fights.
trait_empowered: Your innate power empowers other traits.
trait_blasphemous: Your link to the divine is weakened.
trait_ooze: You are some kind of ooze; everything is more difficult.
trait_untapped: You have untapped potential in your genome.
trait_emfield: You emit a natural electromagnetic field that interferes with electricity.
trait_tactical: A genetic disposition to tactical thinking gives your race an edge in combat.
trait_analytical: Your race has an enhanced analytical mind, which increases your knowledge gain.
trait_promiscuous: Your race has an elevated birth rate.
trait_promiscuous_synth: Your race is designed for mass production.
trait_resilient: Natural resilience to harsh conditions makes your species more adept at coal mining.
trait_cunning: Your race possesses an affinity for tracking game.
trait_hardy: A genetically hardy physiology lets you endure the tough conditions of cement manufacturing.
trait_ambidextrous: A natural ability to work with both hands increases your crafting efficiency.
trait_industrious: Your naturally hard-working citizens produce extra copper and iron ore from mining.
trait_content: Your people are naturally content, reducing the stress gained from everyday life.
trait_fibroblast: Enhanced fibroblasts increase your soldiers' healing factor.
trait_metallurgist: You have a knack for metallurgy, making you more efficient at manufacturing alloys.
trait_gambler: Your species is addicted to gambling; casinos store more money and generate extra revenue.
trait_gambler_effect: Casinos' Money storage and generation increased.
trait_persuasive: You are gifted with a silver tongue and can convince others to give you more for your money.
trait_fortify: Your genes have been fortified to resist genetic decay.
trait_fortify_effect: Fortify genes to resist genetic decay.
trait_mastery: You are connected to the universe. Past experience is increased in value.
biome_grassland: Grassland worlds are covered in plains and are ideal worlds for farming. They are characterized by increased crop yield.
biome_oceanic: Oceanic worlds are mostly covered by water with some land masses scattered around. They are characterized by increased rainfall.
biome_forest: Forest worlds are almost entirely covered with vegetation. They are characterized by an abundance of lumber.
biome_desert: Desert worlds are mostly dusty rocks covered in sand. They are characterized by being very sunny.
biome_volcanic: Volcanic worlds are typically younger planets who haven't yet cooled off. They are characterized by being hot.
biome_tundra: Tundra planets are largely covered in ice and are almost never warm. They are characterized by being cold.
biome_hellscape: The Hellscape planet is a nightmarish place where most things are literally on fire, the air reeks of sulfur, and vegetation is scarce. Most races cannot survive in this place.
biome_eden: The Eden planet is a paradise of lush fields and pure rivers. It is an idyllic world of sunshine and rainbows. Disgusting.
biome_savanna: Savanna planets are largely covered in grasslands with few trees.
biome_swamp: Swamp planets are largely covered in soggy forests. Shallow, tree-filled water covers most of the planet.
biome_ashland: Ashland planets are desert planets covered in ash from the many active volcanos. They are inhospitable places.
biome_taiga: Taiga planets are cold planets covered in icy forests.
planet_toxic_desc: Toxic fumes permeate this world's atmosphere. Birth rates are lower as a result and mutations are more common.
planet_mellow_desc: A naturally-occurring substance fills the atmosphere. It makes life less stressful, but also less productive.
planet_rage_desc: The atmosphere contains traces of a rage-inducing chemical that increases soldier aggression. This makes them deadlier but also less concerned with self-preservation.
planet_stormy_desc: Strong winds are common on this planet, inducing more storms.
planet_ozone_desc: The ozone layer on this planet is very weak, leading to more solar radiation penetrating the atmosphere. Too much sun exposure could be deadly.
planet_magnetic_desc: This planet's magnetic field is unusually strong.
planet_trashed_desc: Trash covers every inch of this planet's surface; it appears some other race used it as a dumping ground.
planet_elliptical_desc: This planet has a highly elliptical orbit, which causes it to have long summers and winters.
planet_flare_desc: Intense solar flares routinely hit this planet; mass extinction events are common. This is a bad planet for life.
planet_dense_desc: This planet is very dense, having more deposits of heavy metals and stronger gravity than is typical for a planet of its size.
planet_unstable_desc: This planet is seismically unstable; structures here require extra reinforcement to withstand constant earthquakes.
planet_permafrost_desc: The ground on this planet has a thick layer of permafrost that makes it harder to dig through. Frozen curiosities help advance knowledge.
planet_retrograde_desc: The moon orbiting this planet has an unusual retrograde orbit.
planet_kamikaze_desc: This planet is slowly moving closer to its parent star and will eventually be ripped apart by tidal forces.
planet_kamikaze_msg: Your planet and moon have fallen too close to their parent star and been ripped apart by tidal forces.
planet_kamikaze_stabilize: You have received new information that the orbit of your home planet %0 will stabilize at %1 days.
wish_taxes: Your legislature accidentally passed a bill that authorizes higher taxes because no one could be bothered to read it.
wish_know: You feel like you suddenly understand the universe better, %0 increased by %1.
wish_gain_res: You found %0 %1 in a warehouse, must have misplaced it.
wish_steal_res: Agents of yours have stolen %0 %1 from private citizens.
wish_gain_double: You found %0 %1, and %2 %3 in a warehouse, must have misplaced it.
wish_robbery: A story has broken about how you filled the coffers by robbing %0 for $%1.
wish_famous: You are now well known for %0.
wish_notorious8: a scandal involving two bowling pins, a goat, and a block of %0 cheese.
wish_reputable6: helping an old man cross the street
wish_reputable8: scoring four touch downs in a single game at polk high
wish_magazine: %0 magazine has voted you the most influential person of the year.
wish_astro: You feel that you have somehow influenced the heavens.
wish_prof: Your followers wish to help spread your ideology.
wish_troop: Soldiers are flocking to your cause.
wish_casino: Your people are suddenly obsessed with playing %0, %1 profits are up.
wish_ship: New reports indicate that your warships are more effective then previously thought.
wish_gov: In a surprise turn of events, your government has dissolved itself and declared you to be the supreme ruler with total authority.
wish_priest: You have gained a devout follower.
wish_priest_fail: The cosmos have decreed that you have enough fanatical followers.
wish_peace_join: %0 has voted to join you as a vassal state.
wish_peace_flower: A bunch of hippies held a festival of flowers to promote peace.
wish_temple: Your people have constructed a %0 to celebrate your greatness.
wish_wonder: A monument to your greatness has been erected!
wish_no_wonder: You don't feel any more great than before.
ocular_disintegration_desc: Disintegration rays increase your combat power by %0%.
ocular_telekinesis_desc: Use your telekenetic powers to improve hard labor jobs by %0%.
civics_gov_tp_rival: The %0 is your primary rival for domination of %1 and beyond. Just as you have managed to unify your region into a strong country, they have done the same in their own region of the world. The two of you are the dominant powers at play.
civics_gov_tp_crime: The %0 is a powerful criminal organization. They operate without borders and have no known central headquarters. Regions without adequate security are often plagued by problems caused by the Syndicate who deal in anything profitable ranging from extortion, counterfeiting, and trafficking to full scale piracy.
civics_gov_spy_desc: Spies reveal information about foreign nations. Next spy cost: $%0.
civics_gov_esp_desc: Risk a spy in an espionage action.
civics_spy_warning: This Foreign Power cannot be affected more by this mission.
civics_spy_influence_desc: Attempt to improve your relations with the %0. Low-risk operation.
civics_spy_influence_success: You have improved your relations with %0 by %1% using covert means.
civics_spy_sabotage_desc: Attempt to sabotage the %0 military capabilities. Medium-risk operation.
civics_spy_sabotage_success: You have weakened the army of %0 by %1 with a covert operation.
civics_spy_incite_desc: Attempt to seed unrest in the %0. High-risk operation.
civics_spy_incite_success: You have seeded unrest in %0 by %1% with a covert operation.
civics_spy_annex_goal: Unrest is high in %0; if you can raise your morale to %1 it could be possible to annex %0 as a territory.
civics_spy_annex_desc: Unrest is high in %0 and their citizens think highly of you; it is now possible to annex %0 as a territory.
civics_spy_purchase_desc: Everything is for sale... for the right price. In this case, the price of the %0 is $%1.
civics_change_desc: You can trigger a revolution in %0 days.
civics_force_rev_desc: You can start a revolution to change your government now, but you'll suffer a heavy morale penalty.
civics_tax_rates_desc: High tax rates yield more money but reduce morale, low taxes have the inverse effect.
civics_garrison_deoccupy_desc: Unoccupy the city. Lose the occupation bonus for this city but regain your troops.
civics_garrison_autodeoccupy_desc: Your city has a deficiency of soldiers guarding it. You relinquish control over the %0 and your soldiers come back.
civics_garrison_secede_desc: Secede this city from your empire. Lose bonus for this city, but stop paying upkeep costs.
civics_garrison_campaign_no_soldier: Cannot start a campaign without any soldiers.
civics_garrison_victorious: Your army was victorious! %0 soldiers died in the conflict.
civics_garrison_victorious_revive: Your army was victorious! %0 soldiers died; however, %1 soldiers revived.
civics_garrison_soldier_infected: 1 enemy soldier was infected during the battle.
civics_garrison_soldiers_infected: %0 enemy soldiers were infected during the battle.
civics_garrison_defeat: Your army was defeated. %0 soldiers died in the conflict.
civics_garrison_defeat_revive: Your army was defeated. %0 soldiers died; however, %1 soldiers revived.
civics_garrison_tactic_ambush_desc: Attempt to ambush a rival caravan and steal their goods. Low-risk operation, but low reward.
civics_garrison_tactic_raid_desc: Attempt to raid a rival camp. Medium-risk operation with average payoff potential.
civics_garrison_tactic_pillage_desc: Attempt to pillage a rival settlement. High-risk operation with superior payoff potential.
civics_garrison_tactic_assault_desc: Attempt to assault a rival town. Very high-risk operation with huge payoff potential.
civics_garrison_tactic_siege_desc: Attempt to siege a rival city. Allows you to occupy an enemy city as long as %0 troops remain alive after the siege.
civics_garrison_no_spy: Low Intel, Battle Assessment Unavailable. Embed more spies.
civics_garrison_army_label: Number of soldiers to commit to military campaigns.
civics_garrison_soldier_desc: Idle soldiers spend their time hunting.
civics_garrison_soldier_evil_desc: Idle soldiers spend their time trapping mortals.
civics_garrison_soldier_loot1: They are currently bringing in %0 %1 per second.
civics_garrison_soldier_loot2: They are currently bringing in %0 %1 and %2 %3 per second.
civics_garrison_soldier_loot3: They are currently bringing in %0 %1, %2 %3, and %4 %5 per second.
civics_garrison_wounded_desc: Wounded soldiers are both less effective in combat and more likely to die. Wounded soldiers will heal over time.
civics_garrison_crew_desc: Military personnel assigned to crew ships.
civics_rival_unlocked: A rival region has unified, creating a powerful new country called the %0.
civics_mad_reset_desc: This will reset the game; you will gain some %0 and you may gain some other minor bonuses as a result. Export a save state before proceeding.
civics_mad_missiles_world_control_desc: Enable or Disable the launch button. Scour the world clean with nuclear fire. Why? Because you can.
civics_mad_missiles_desc: Enable or Disable the launch button. Launching a nuclear strike will trigger a retaliatory strike which will result in the end of all life as we know it.
civics_mad_missiles_desc_easter: Enable or Disable the launch button. Launching a Holy Rocket Propelled Grenade strike will trigger a retaliatory strike which will result in the end of all life as we know it.
civics_mad_missiles_warning: This will result in the destruction of all life on your planet. You will have to re-evolve from the beginning. You will gain %0 %1.
civics_servants_desc: Completely devoted to you, these servants can work any basic job and do not require any upkeep.
civics_servants_msg1: A ferret-like creature has joined you, ready to serve your empire.
civics_servants_msg2: %0 ferret-like creatures have joined you and are ready to serve your empire.
civics_skilled_servants_desc: Completely devoted to you, these servants can work any basic job or non-special craftsman job, and do not require any upkeep.
governor_soldier_desc: Soldiers have a background with military service and bring their experience of warfare.
governor_criminal_desc: Criminals have certain skills which help them get things done... just don't ask too many questions.
governor_entrepreneur_desc: Entrepreneurs are experts in capitalizing on opportunity. If a profit can be made, they'll find a way.
governor_educator_desc: Educators have experience with higher education, which gives them insights into the science sector.
governor_spiritual_desc: Spiritualists are experts in faith and can help your people live full, meaningful lives.
governor_bluecollar_desc: Bluecollar workers are the backbone of your workforce, and they know a lot about how heavy industries operate.
governor_noble_desc: The Nobles are a ruling class that are often seen as detached from the common folk, but they are usually highly respected and have mastery of the finer aspects of society.
governor_media_desc: A background in media means they know how to manipulate the narrative. They are masters of propaganda.
governor_sports_desc: An athletic background means they are an expert in fitness and entertainment.
governor_bureaucrat_desc: Bureaucrat are experienced politicians; they know how to manage people effectively.
gov_trait_tactician_desc: Tactical experience helps improve your forces' combat performance.
gov_trait_militant_desc: A military background improves combat readiness of your troops.
gov_trait_noquestions_desc: Certain skills help get things done; just don't ask any questions.
gov_trait_racketeer_desc: A lot of palms need to be kept greased to keep things working smoothly.
gov_trait_racketeer_effect: -%0% income lost to corruption. +%1% Casino Profits.
gov_trait_dealmaker_desc: An expert in the art of the deal will help you get things you need.
gov_trait_dealmaker_effect: Trade Route Imports +%0% goods. Can not have more Imports than Exports.
gov_trait_risktaker_effect: Commodity market price drift rate increased. +%0% Bank Money Capacity.
gov_trait_teacher_desc: Effective teaching techniques increase the value of educational institutions.
gov_trait_teacher_effect: %0% increased University and Library Knowledge Cap.
gov_trait_theorist_desc: Theory is good for research, but lack of practical experience can be an issue.
gov_trait_theorist_effect: %0% larger research queue. %1% reduced Miner, Lumberjack, and Cement Worker production.
gov_trait_inspirational_desc: Inspiring the people can make them more productive.
gov_trait_inspirational_effect: %0% increased Farmer, Miner, Lumberjack, and Cement Worker production.
gov_trait_pious_desc: Drawing in the devout could be good for your spirit.
gov_trait_pious_effect: %0% income lost to tithing. $%1 Tourist income per Temple.
gov_trait_pragmatist_desc: A pragmatic outlook could help get more done.
gov_trait_dirty_jobs_desc: Knowing how to get the dirty jobs done could be benifical.
gov_trait_dirty_jobs_effect: -%0 Basic Powerplants, Mines, Factory, Smelter, and Oil Derrick cost creep. +%1MW generated by Basic Powerplants. +%2% Miner, Smelter, and Oil Derrick production.
gov_trait_extravagant_desc: A taste for the finer things will drive up costs.
gov_trait_extravagant_effect: +%0% Money costs. %1 converted into Mansion (%2MW and %3 citizens).
gov_trait_aristocrat_desc: A noble background has its perks, but also makes them disconnected from the common folk.
gov_trait_aristocrat_effect: Government lockout timer reduced by %0%. Maximum tax rate increased by %1%. Tax riots can occur at tax rates %2% lower than normal if morale is not kept up.
gov_trait_gaslighter_desc: Repeat lies often enough and people will believe them.
gov_trait_gaslighter_effect: %0% increased morale boost from powered %1. %2% increased VR Center morale. %3% decreased max morale from monuments.
gov_trait_muckraker_desc: A specialty in digging up dirt creates a high volume of low-quality information.
gov_trait_muckraker_effect: Journalists occasionally uncover scandals. %0% increased Library Max Knowledge. -%1% Library knowledge production.
gov_trait_athleticism_desc: A focus on athletics boosts entertainment but lowers scientific endeavours.
gov_trait_athleticism_effect: Amphitheatre replaced with Stadium (+%0% Max Morale and +%1 Entertainers). -%2% University, Library, and %3 Max Knowledge.
gov_trait_nopain_desc: Those with a high tolerence for pain can push through otherwise intolerable conditions.
gov_trait_nopain_effect: Wounded heal %0% faster. Surveyors %1% less likely to be killed.
gov_trait_organizer_desc: A good taskmaster can keep everything operating smoothly.
gov_trait_organizer_effect: %0 extra task slot. Slightly increased government effects.
power_grid_header: Click and drag to reorder the priority for powering structures.
govern_anarchy_desc: Anarchy is having no government. Personal freedom is high, but it is unsustainable with large populations. Chaos will spiral out of control as your population grows.
govern_anarchy_effect: As your population grows, production is decreased. Job stress is halved.
govern_autocracy_desc: Autocracy is a form of government where one person holds all the power. No one may question your authority.
govern_autocracy_effect: Stress is %0% higher, but military power is %1% stronger. Warmonger penalty is disabled.
govern_democracy_desc: Democracy is a form of government where all the people collectively make decisions together. This is popular with the people but makes getting anything done tedious.
govern_democracy_effect: Entertainers are %0% more effective, but worker production and combat rating are %1% lower.
govern_managed_democracy_desc: Managed Democracy is a form of government where all the people collectively vote on things to make decisions. However the votes are all rigged and this only gives the illusion of choice to citizens.
govern_managed_democracy_effect: Entertainers are %0% more effective, but worker production and combat rating are %1% lower. Authority loss from high morale is lessened.
govern_oligarchy_desc: Oligarchy is a form of government where the elite rule as a council. A handful of powerful families control everything and make all the major decisions.
govern_oligarchy_effect: Tax revenue is %0% lower, but taxes can be set %1% higher, high tax morale penalty is lower, and people are less likely to riot.
govern_oligarchy_effect_alt: Taxes can be set %0% higher, high tax morale penalty is lower, and people are less likely to riot.
govern_theocracy_desc: A Theocracy is a state that is ruled by religious elite. The church is the supreme institution and everything is usually done in the name of God. As the head of the church, your word is law.
govern_theocracy_effect: Temples are %0% more effective. Professors are %1% less effective. Scientists are %2% less effective.
govern_theocracy_effect_alt: Temples are %0% more effective. Professors are %1% less effective. Scientists are %2% less effective. Priests boost Ziggurats.
govern_republic_desc: A Republic is similar to a democracy, only people elect officials to represent them in government instead of voting on everything themselves.
govern_republic_effect: Bankers are %0% more effective and morale is raised by %1%, but people protest about every random thing.
govern_socialist_desc: Under a socialist government the state owns everything. Personal freedom is low, but the state provides for all basic needs.
govern_socialist_effect: Crafting gains a %0% bonus, and factories/manufacturing plants gain %1%. Stress is increased by %2%. Money income is reduced by %3%.
govern_corpocracy_desc: A corpocracy is a society that has taken capitalism to an extreme. The government is controlled by a board of the most powerful CEOs.
govern_corpocracy_effect: Tax revenue is halved, but income from casinos (+%0%), luxury goods (+%1%), and tourism (+%2%) is higher. Morale suffers a -%3% penalty but factories and manufacturing plants produce %4% more.
govern_technocracy_desc: A technocracy is similar to an oligarchy, only the ruling council is composed of people who are considered the top experts in their fields. Scientific or technical knowledge is valued most.
govern_technocracy_effect: Knowledge costs are reduced by %0%, but raw material costs are increased by %1%. Knowledge generated is also increased by %2%.
govern_technocracy_effect_alt: Knowledge costs are reduced by %0%. Knowledge generated is also increased by %1%.
govern_federation_desc: A federation is a system of government where individual states largely govern themselves but are united under a central government.
govern_federation_effect: Rival cities under your control grant %0% more production. They also require no upkeep cost unless under military occupation. Morale is raised by %1%.
govern_federation_effect_alt: Unification production bonus is raised from +%0% to %1%. Morale is raised by %2%.
govern_magocracy_desc: A magocracy is a government run by a ruling council of arch mages. The pursuit of magic is emphasized over all other concerns.
govern_magocracy_effect: Wizards produce %0% more mana. Crystal production increased by %1%.
govern_dictator_desc: A Dictatorship is a government run by a single person with absolute authority.
govern_dictator_effect: Job stress is %0% higher, but all production is %1% higher and costs of common materials are reduced by %2%.
govern_authority: Authority per solider is increased by %0%.
resource_Plasmid_desc: %0 active Plasmids are providing a global production boost of %1%.
resource_Plasmid_desc2: They also grant a spatial reasoning bonus to your storage of %0%.
resource_AntiPlasmid_desc: %0 Anti-Plasmids are providing a global production boost of %1%.
resource_Phage_desc: Phage increases the soft cap of Plasmids by 1 per Phage. Your Plasmid softcap is currently %0.
resource_Phage_desc2: Phage increases the soft cap of Plasmids and Anti-Plasmids by 1 per Phage. Your softcap is currently %0.
resource_Dark_desc_s: Dark Energy increases your storage bonus by %0%.
resource_Dark_desc_e: Dark Energy increases the loot gained from combat by %0%. Authority combat rating boost increased by %1%.
resource_Dark_desc_m: Dark Energy reduces planetary cost creep by %0 and non-homeworld cost creep by %1.
resource_Dark_desc_h: Dark Energy reduces the heavy fuel cost penalty to %0% and to %1% beyond your solar system.
resource_Dark_desc_a: Dark Energy increases all power generated by %0%.
resource_Dark_desc_mg: Dark Energy increases the production of %0 by %1%.
resource_Harmony_desc: Harmony Crystals boost the effectiveness of Dark Energy by %0% per crystal. They also provide a non-homeworld cost creep discount of %1 in the current universe.
resource_AICore_desc: AI Cores boost your Quantum Level. With your current number of cores you are gaining a %0% bonus.
resource_Supercoiled_desc: Supercoiled Plasmids provide a production bonus of %0%.
resource_Supercoiled_trade_desc: Additionally they increase trade volume gains by %0%.
resource_modal_crate_construct_desc: Construct a crate; costs %0 %1. Each crate provides %2 storage.
resource_modal_crate_unassign_desc: Remove crate from this resource (-%0 cap)
resource_modal_crate_assign_desc: Assign crate to this resource (+%0 cap)
resource_modal_container_construct_desc: Construct a container; costs %0 steel. Each container provides %1 storage.
resource_modal_container_unassign_desc: Remove container from this resource (-%0 cap)
resource_modal_container_assign_desc: Assign container to this resource (+%0 cap)
psychic_boost_desc: Boost production of a single resource by %0%.
psychic_murder_desc: Kill one of your citizens in cold blood.
psychic_mind_break_desc: Convert a captive into a thrall
psychic_stun_desc: Capture a surface dweller so you can later convert them into a thrall.
space_home_test_launch_effect: Launch an experimental test rocket into space.
space_home_test_launch_action: You have successfully launched your first rocket into space!
space_home_test_launch_action_fail: Your rocket launch test was a failure; you suspect sabotage.
space_home_gps_effect_req: You need a minimum of 4 GPS satellites to establish a GPS signal. The first 3 effectively do nothing.
space_moon_info_desc: The moon orbiting %0. It is about 1/10th the mass of %0 and has no atmosphere.
space_moon_mission_effect: Launch a mission to survey the moon.
space_moon_mission_action: Your lunar rovers have detected significant stores of iridium and helium-3.
space_moon_base_msg: The %0 has also established their own moon bases.
space_moon_base_msg_hstl: Your hostile relations with them are decreasing your moon production.
space_moon_base_msg_ally: Your good relations with them benefit both nations, increasing moon production.
space_moon_helium_mine_desc: Extract Helium-3 from the lunar surface
space_red_info_desc: The red planet %0 orbits the sun at a distance of about 1.4AU.
space_red_mission_effect: Launch a mission to survey the red planet %0.
space_red_mission_action: %0 doesn't offer much in the way of rare resources, but your scientists consider it to be the best prospect for an off-world colony.
space_terraformer_effect: Slowly transforms the atmosphere to be more hospitable to your species.
space_terraformer_effect2: Power this facility to begin transforming your planet.
space_terraform_effect: Terraform this planet into one of your own design. It might even be more suitable for another evolution.
space_red_factory_effect1: Factories can be used to produce any number of manufactured goods.
space_red_asphodel_desc: Cultivate asphodel flowers to attract mediocre souls
space_red_biodome_flair: All it took was growing a potato
space_red_asphodel_flair: For the souls who will never reach paradise
space_red_exotic_lab_flair2: the wall here to see what sticks.
space_red_ziggurat_desc: Ziggurat dedicated to an ancient race of %0
space_hell_info_desc: The planet %0 is located about 0.4AU from the sun and is very hot.
space_hell_mission_effect1: Launch a mission to survey the hellish planet %0.
space_hell_mission_action: %0 is a hot planet close to the sun. Its prospects for development are poor.
space_hell_swarm_plant_effect1: Reduces the cost of swarm satellites by %0%
space_sun_info_desc: The star at the heart of the %0 system.
space_sun_mission_effect1: Launch a mission to study the sun.
space_sun_swarm_control_effect1: Controls up to %0 Swarm Satellites and transmits their power back to civilization.
space_gas_info_desc: The planet %0 is a gas giant located about 5.2AU from the sun. It is the largest planet in the %1 system.
space_gas_mission_effect: Launch a mission to study the gas giant %0.
space_gas_mission_action: %0 is truly massive, and its atmosphere is rich in Helium-3.
space_gas_storage_desc: Orbital depot used to store fuels
space_gas_star_dock_wiki: Space Station orbiting the gas giant used to construct ships to explore the galaxy.
space_gas_moon_info_desc: %0 is the largest moon orbiting the gas giant %1.
space_gas_moon_mission_action: A superdense material composed entirely of neutrons has been discovered on %0.
space_gas_moon_drone_effect1: Increase the output of mining outposts by %0%
space_belt_info_desc: The asteroid belt is located between %0 and %1; it is a potentially rich source of resources.
space_belt_info_desc2: You must assign space miners to increase support in the asteroid belt.
space_belt_mission_desc: Launch a survey of the Asteroid Belt
space_belt_mission_effect1: Launch a mission to study the asteroid belt for potential mining opportunities.
space_belt_mission_action: The asteroid belt is extremely hazardous but contains immense mineral wealth.
space_dwarf_info_desc: %0 is a dwarf planet located about 2.8AU from the sun. It is the only known dwarf planet in the inner solar system.
space_dwarf_mission_action: %0 appears to be a lifeless rock with little resources of value. It's the perfect place to store hazardous materials.
space_dwarf_collider_effect1: Construct a 1-mile segment of the world supercollider
space_dwarf_collider_flair: What's the worst that could happen?
space_dwarf_mass_relay_effect: Construct part of the Mass Relay
space_dwarf_mass_relay_effect2: Triples speed of ships leaving from %0
space_titan_info_desc: The moon %0 is the largest moon orbiting the 2nd gas giant in the %1 system. It averages around 9.54AU from the sun and has a dense planet-like atmosphere.
space_titan_mission_effect: Launch a mission to study the moon %0.
space_titan_mission_action: %0 is the most %1-like planetoid you've discovered so far. Although challenging due to the cold temperatures and lack of liquid water, it would be possible to set up a permanent colony here.
space_enceladus_info_desc: The moon %0 is the 6th-largest moon orbiting the 2nd gas giant in the %1 system. Geyser jets continuously eject water into space from the moon's surface.
space_enceladus_mission_action: A massive subterranean ocean of liquid water exists on %0. This could be an important source of water for your colonies.
space_triton_info_desc: %0 is the largest moon orbiting the farthest planet in the %1 system. It has a retrograde orbit and an icy surface made mostly of frozen nitrogen.
space_triton_mission_effect: Launch a mission to investigate the signal coming from the moon %0.
space_triton_mission_action: A massive crashed spaceship of unknown origin has been found on %0. Syndicate spies have learned of your discovery and are preparing an expedition force of their own to steal it. You must secure this important relic.
space_fob_msg: Syndicate forces have landed ground troops; you must wage war both in space and on the ground.
space_kuiper_desc: The Kuiper Belt is a vast area surrounding the solar system made up of asteroids and other stellar objects. It is comprised of everything in the region of space from about 30AU to 50AU from the sun.
space_kuiper_mission_effect: Launch a mission to scout areas of interest in the Kuiper Belt identified from the derelict ship data.
space_kuiper_mission_action: Several mineral rich sites have been identified in the Kuiper Belt; however, Syndicate ships were also detected scouting the area.
space_eris_info_desc: %0 is a dwarf planet located 68AU from the sun. It is the 9th-largest known object by mass to orbit the sun.
space_eris_mission_effect: Launch a mission to scout the dwarf planet %0.
space_eris_mission_action: %0 is a frozen wasteland on the outer edge of the solar system. A spectrographic analysis indicates nothing valuable enough to warrant further expeditions this far out; however, your probe detected a Syndicate buildup here. Perhaps you should dispatch ships to find out what they have discovered.
space_eris_scan: The Syndicate activity is organized mostly around a dig site on %0. They seem to be excavating some kind of alien outpost.
interstellar_alpha_desc1: Alpha Centauri is a nearby binary star system located 4.36 light years from %0. We suspect several planets may be orbiting it.
interstellar_alpha_desc2: Alpha Centauri is a nearby binary star system located 4.36 light years from %0. The 4th planet, designated Alpha Centauri IV, is a candidate for a permanent extrasolar base.
interstellar_alpha_mission_effect: Send a ship to the Alpha Centauri system to survey it.
interstellar_alpha_mission_result: Alpha Centauri IV appears to be a great candidate for a colony.
interstellar_mining_droid_effect: Mining Droids can be tasked to extract valuable materials from the ground. They can be set to mine Adamantite, Uranium, Coal, or Aluminium.
interstellar_int_factory_effect: Manufacture new materials from old materials. Each Mega Factory has two production lines.
interstellar_proxima_desc1: Proxima Centauri is a red dwarf located about 0.21 light years from the Alpha Centauri system.
interstellar_proxima_desc2: Proxima Centauri is a red dwarf located about 0.21 light years from the Alpha Centauri system. A lone rocky planet orbits the system.
interstellar_proxima_mission_effect: Send a ship to the Proxima Centauri system to determine if it has any value.
interstellar_proxima_mission_result: A lone rocky planet of little value orbits the Proxima system. However, Proxima's strategic position makes it a great place for an interstellar base of operations.
interstellar_xfer_station_desc: A deep space station used as a hub for the region
interstellar_nebula_desc1: The Helix Nebula is quite far away at 694 light years, but this could be a very rich source of Helium-3 to fuel your expansion.
interstellar_nebula_desc2: The Helix Nebula is quite far away at 694 light years. It is rich in valuable Helium-3.
interstellar_nebula_mission_effect: Send a ship to the Helix Nebula to evaluate it for possible gas mining operations.
interstellar_nebula_mission_result: The Helix Nebula is rich in Helium-3, as expected. It also contains Deuterium, and deposits of Elerium have been detected.
interstellar_nexus_desc: A deep space station used as a hub for the region
interstellar_neutron_desc1: A neutron star has been detected roughly 619 light years away.
interstellar_neutron_desc2: The Neutron Star, Calvera, is roughly 619 light years from %0.
interstellar_neutron_mission_effect: Embark on a dangerous mission to study the neutron star, Calvera.
interstellar_neutron_mission_result: Dangerous x-ray emissions make the neutron star Calvera extremely dangerous to approach; only shielded craft should approach it.
interstellar_stellar_forge_flair: The power of the sun in the palm of your hand
interstellar_blackhole_desc1: A small black hole has been detected 487 light years from %0.
interstellar_blackhole_desc2: The black hole is located 487 light years from %0. It is small as far as black holes go, with a mass of only 8 solar masses.
interstellar_blackhole_desc3: The black hole is located 487 light years from %0. It has a mass of %1 solar masses.
interstellar_blackhole_desc4: The black hole is located 487 light years from %0. It has a mass of %1 solar masses, with exotic matter making up %2 solar mass.
interstellar_blackhole_desc5: The black hole could be worth %0 %3, %1 Phage, and %2 Dark Energy if it were to somehow explode...
interstellar_blackhole_mission_effect: Scout the black hole... for science!
interstellar_blackhole_mission_result: The black hole is relatively low-mass. While still highly dangerous, this makes it easier to study.
interstellar_blackhole_unstable: The black hole is starting to emit odd readings; this might be due to the exotic matter contamination.
interstellar_stellar_engine_effect2: Black hole mass is %0 solar masses.
interstellar_stellar_engine_effect3: Black hole mass is %0 solar masses, with exotic matter making up %1 solar mass.
interstellar_mass_ejector_effect: Eject mass into the black hole to enlarge it
interstellar_mass_ejector_flair: This is a good idea, this is fine
interstellar_mass_ejector_msg: A new tab is available under "Resources"
interstellar_jump_ship_effect: Construct a special ship designed to navigate a natural wormhole. This ship must be heavily shielded and requires a unique drive capable of jumping into and out of an unstable wormhole.
interstellar_wormhole_mission_effect: Send the specially-designed jump ship into the unstable wormhole and see what's on the other side.
interstellar_wormhole_mission_result: You have successfully jumped the wormhole; an analysis of the stars places the destination as somewhere in the Andromeda galaxy!
interstellar_stargate_effect: Using the jumpship to transverse the natural wormhole, we can construct matching stargates which will allow stable travel to the faraway Andromeda galaxy without needing specially-designed ships that can withstand jumping a singularity.
interstellar_sirius_desc: Sirius is a binary star system 8.6 light years from the %0 system. Sirius A is a type M star, while Sirius B is a White Dwarf.
interstellar_sirius_b_desc: Sirius B is a white dwarf star, which means fusion has stopped and it has cooled enough for the surface to solidify, but it will continue to radiate great amounts of heat for trillions of years.
interstellar_sirius_mission_effect: Sirius is a system that was previously of low interest to the %0 Empire, but the ascension project has caused interest in studying a White Dwarf star and its close proximity to the %1 system makes it an ideal candidate.
interstellar_sirius_b_effect: Analyze Sirius B to unlock its secrets.
interstellar_space_elevator_effect: Sirius B's gravity is too strong to simply land ships on it; we need to construct a space elevator to access the surface.
interstellar_gravity_dome_effect: Sirius B's gravity is 350,000x stronger than %0. A special dome that can withstand the extreme pressure is required to house the project.
interstellar_ascension_machine_effect: The "Ascension Machine" is a device that can elevate your people to a new plane of existence. Constructing and activating this device is the ultimate goal for the %0 race.
interstellar_ascension_trigger_effect: The Ascension Machine; turning on this device will elevate your people to a new plane of existence.
interstellar_thermal_collector_effect: Reduces the power requirement of the Ascension Machine by -%0MW.
galaxy_piracy_msg: The %0 pirates have taken notice of your operations. You must increase security in each sector to counter the threat.
galaxy_stargate_desc: The region around the stargate is mostly empty space. There is a nearby star system 0.4 light years away, but not much else in the vicinity.
galaxy_stargate_desc_alt: The stargate is a critical transit point for your empire; security in this area will affect all production in Andromeda.
galaxy_gateway_station_desc: Gateway Station is a first stop foothold in the new galaxy.
galaxy_telemetry_beacon_effect1: +%0 Max Knowledge for each active Telemetry Beacon.
galaxy_gateway_desc: The Gateway system is the closest destination from the stargate at 0.4 light years. Logistically, this makes it a good staging ground for your expansion.
galaxy_gateway_mission_effect: Send a ship to the Gateway System to scout it for use as your base of operations in the Andromeda galaxy.
galaxy_encounter: One of your scout ships encountered an unknown alien vessel; your ship was destroyed after a failed attempt to communicate with the aliens.
galaxy_gorddon_desc: The Gorddon system is 14 light years from the stargate and seems to be a hotbed for alien activity. The system was named in honor of Captain Gorddon, who died during the first contact disaster.
galaxy_gorddon_mission_effect: A high amount of alien activity has been detected in the Gorddon System; it's possible a colony exists there. Attempt to make second contact with this species.
galaxy_gorddon_mission_result: You have established contact with a species of %0 that calls themselves %1. The first contact incident seems to have been the work of a hostile rival species of %2 called %3, but your relationship remains tenuous.
galaxy_embassy_complete: You have established relations with the %0 race. You can now negotiate trade routes with them by constructing freighters. The %0 warn you that %1 piracy is a big concern in the region; you'll need to protect your interests by building up your armada.
galaxy_symposium_effect2: +%0 Max Knowledge per active Galactic Trade Route
galaxy_symposium_effect3: +%0 Max Knowledge per crew stationed in system
galaxy_freighter_assign: Assign a freighter to import %0 and export %1.
galaxy_freighter_unassign: Unassign a freighter from importing %0 and exporting %1.
galaxy_alien1_desc: The %0 System is the home system of the %1. It is a binary star system 4.2 light years from the Gorddon System.
galaxy_consulate_desc: The Consulate is your local diplomatic office in the %0 system.
galaxy_vitreloy_plant_desc: Requires Power, Bolognium, Stanene, and Money.
galaxy_alien2_desc: The %0 System is a type G star system with heavy %1 activity in it. This system is rich with resources and the %1 do not take kindly to anyone else approaching it.
galaxy_alien2_mission_effect: Station the required invasion force at the %0 system then initiate the attack.
galaxy_alien2_mission_result2: You have successfully broken the %0 blockade, establishing a foothold in the system.
galaxy_scavenger_find: Your scavengers have recovered an alien database. You should research the alien data.
galaxy_chthonian_desc: The Chthonian system is named such because it contains the only known Chthonian planet ever detected by you. Strange readings emanate from the planet; however, the system is also fiercely guarded by the %0.
galaxy_chthonian_mission_result: You have weakened the enemy forces enough to allow entry into the system.
galaxy_chthonian_mission_result_losses: The following ships were lost during the battle: %0.
portal_first_gem: Your soldiers discovered a peculiar stone in the aftermath of a battle. It makes everyone who goes near it uneasy and almost seems to be alive.
portal_corrupt_gem: The Soul Forge has produced an unusual Soul Gem; anyone who touches it is overcome by fits of rage and temporary insanity.
portal_fortress_desc: A large fortress constructed in the Hell dimension to guard the portal.
portal_carport_desc: Each carport adds a support vehicle for %0 surveyor. Damaged vehicles must be repaired before they can be occupied by surveyors.
portal_war_droid_effect: Each droid will reinforce one patrol unit; excess droids will defend the fortress.
portal_repair_droid_flair: I am bender, please insert girder
portal_badlands_desc: The badlands seem to go on infinitely in every direction. There is no measurable curvature to the plains over distance, causing speculation about the flat nature of this realm. There appears to be nothing out here but desolate wasteland and never-ending hordes of demons.
portal_war_drone_effect: Remotely-piloted drones provide air support for your patrols and help reduce the demonic population.
portal_attractor_desc: These arcane beacons attract demons, increasing demonic activity in the area.
portal_hell_pit_found: Your hell patrols have found a giant crater that is swarming with unusually high levels of demonic activity.
portal_pit_desc: The "pit" is a giant crater that is swarming with demonic activity. The endless hordes seem to be drawn to this location more than others.
portal_pit_mission_effect: Something is attracting demons to this area. Undertake a mission to find out.
portal_pit_mission_result: There appears to be some kind of ruins in the center of the pit. You will have to secure the ruins to study it further.
portal_assault_forge_effect: Mount an assault force to secure the pit and establish defensive fortifications.
portal_assault_forge_result: Upon securing the ruins, you discover a sophisticated artifact. Further research is required.
portal_soul_forge_desc: Captures the souls of defeated demons
portal_soul_forge_effect: Fuses the souls of defeated demons into a %0.
portal_gun_emplacement_desc: Reduces soldier requirement of Soul Forge
portal_soul_attractor_effect: Attracts %0-%1 roaming souls into your Soul Forge per day.
portal_soul_attractor_effect2: Decreases souls required by Soul Forge by %0%.
portal_soul_capacitor_desc: Stores spirit energy harvested by the Soul Forge.
portal_absorption_chamber_effect: Activate to absorb the spirit energy and ascend. Requires %0 Spirit Energy.
portal_absorption_chamber_effect_eld: Activate to summon an Eldritch Horror. Requires %0 Spirit Energy.
portal_absorption_chamber_incomplete: Absorb the spirit energy for the purpose of ascension.
portal_ruins_desc: The ruins of an ancient city lay here. Crumbling remains of structures lay everywhere and twisted creatures roam the ruins. This place looks to have been abandoned eons ago.
portal_ruins_mission_result: You have found several interesting sites in the ruins worth exploring. Most of the large demon hordes seem to avoid the city for unknown reasons, but some dangerous creatures still roam the ruins.
portal_ruins_vault: Your archaeologists have discovered a chamber with an ornate closed vault.
portal_vault_effect: An ancient sealed vault. There is an altar in front of it with %0 sockets that look like they fit Soul Gems.
portal_vault_effect2: The Soul Gems triggered the door mechanism, but it jammed. You'll have to repair the door mechanism to open it.
portal_vault_result: Inside the vault you find an ancient tome called the Codex Infernium. You must study this tome to unlock its secrets.
portal_ancient_pillars_effect: %0 large pillars arranged in a perfect circle; it kind of reminds you of Stonehenge. Each one has a different symbol on it.
portal_ancient_pillars_effect2: %0 large pillars arranged in a perfect circle. Each one has a different symbol on it. %1 of the pillars glow with a soft blue light that seems to come from nowhere.
portal_gate_desc: A massive wall on the far side of the ruined city seems to run across the landscape. A grand gate is present near the ancient ruins. All aircraft sent over the wall stop transmitting immediately and have failed to return.
portal_gate_mission_result: The gate uses a complex locking mechanism which appears impossible to bypass. Fortunately for you, the Codex Infernium outlines a process to build a "key" to open the gate.
portal_lake_desc: Beyond the wall a large "lake" exists. The lake appears to be filled not with water but with blood. The blood is boiling and tiny bubbles pop across the surface. A steady heat radiates from the surface of the lake. An island can be seen in the distance with a great tower on it.
portal_lake_mission_effect: An unusual large lake exists here; scout the area to establish a base of operations.
portal_lake_mission_result: Samples of the lake water have been retrieved for analysis. A spot has been picked to construct a harbor, but the unusual properties of the "water" require more study before anything can be constructed.
portal_cooling_tower_effect: Reduces the power needed to keep your Harbors cool by %0%.
portal_transport_unlocked: Spire Supplies have been unlocked. Go to Resources Tab -> Spire Supply Tab to manage your Supply Cargo.
portal_spire_desc: An island containing an enormous tower exists at the center of the lake. It is so tall you can't see where it ends. Your view of the spire fades into the hazy sky; you feel as if an ominous presence gazes down on you.
portal_spire_mission_effect: Send a team ashore to scout the island with the mysterious spire.
portal_spire_mission_result: You sent an expedition ashore to scout the island, but a deadly miasma covers the island and everyone who went ashore died.
portal_spire_mission_flair: The air here smells foul... it's probably nothing.
portal_spire_bridge_collapse: A bridge crossing a lava river that leads to the spire appears to have collapsed. You'll have to reconstruct it.
portal_sphinx_desc: A creature guards the spire that you've taken to calling the "Sphinx".
portal_sphinx_effect: It won't let you pass; try to learn how to get past the "Sphinx".
portal_sphinx_effect3: The Sphinx no longer blocks your way.
portal_sphinx_msg: The "Sphinx" has asked you to prove you are worthy by answering a series of complicated mathematical equations. You've also noticed it seems to have a fondness for eating soul gems and likes shiny things; maybe you could bribe it?
portal_sphinx_answer_msg: The Sphinx moves out of the way, allowing you access to the tower.
portal_sphinx_bribe_msg: The Sphinx has given you a book, but it refuses to move out of the doorway.
portal_spire_survey_effect: Survey the inside of the Tower.
portal_spire_survey_msg: A holographic device found in the lobby of the spire indicates that each level of the tower is like a micro world with a unique biome filled with dangerous monsters and that in order to climb the spire you must defeat a floor guardian on each level. You devise a plan to construct combat mechs to ascend the tower.
portal_mechbay_effect: Houses Mechs to assault the Spire
portal_mechbay_unlocked: The Mech Lab has been unlocked. Go to Civics Tab -> Mech Lab Tab to manage your mechs.
portal_waygate_effect: Construct a portal to reach an Elder Demon Lord. This requires blood sacrifices.
portal_waygate_open: Divert your mech forces to battle the Demon Lord.
portal_edenic_gate_effect: Modify the Waygate to reach a different realm.
portal_edenic_gate_effect_complete: The Waygate has connected to a higher plane.
portal_spire_type_sand_desc: The majority of the terrain is sandy.
portal_spire_type_swamp_desc: Swamp land covers most of the terrain.
portal_spire_type_forest_desc: Trees grow everywhere across the landscape.
portal_spire_type_jungle_desc: Thick jungle-like plant life grows everywhere.
portal_spire_type_rocky_desc: Rocky terrain covers the entire landscape.
portal_spire_type_gravel_desc: A gravel-like surface covers the terrain.
portal_spire_type_muddy_desc: The whole landscape is covered in mud that's up to a meter deep in places.
portal_spire_type_grass_desc: A nice grassy surface covers the land.
portal_spire_type_concrete_desc: The entire landscape is just a flat, open area paved in concrete.
portal_spire_status_freeze_desc: The air temperature is freezing cold.
portal_spire_status_hot_desc: The air temperature is smoldering hot.
portal_spire_status_hilly_desc: The terrain is not very flat.
portal_spire_status_radioactive_desc: A high Geiger count can be read anywhere in this land.
portal_spire_status_dust_desc: Thick dust coats everything here and gets into everything.
portal_spire_status_river_desc: A river is present here, and must be crossed.
portal_spire_status_tar_desc: Tar pits are scattered around presenting a hazard.
portal_spire_status_steam_desc: Steam jets blast out of fissures across the land.
portal_spire_status_flooded_desc: The whole land is flooded under several inches of water.
portal_spire_status_rain_desc: The rain here never seems to stop.
portal_spire_status_hail_desc: Hail constantly falls from the sky.
portal_spire_status_chasm_desc: A chasm run through the land that must be crossed.
portal_spire_status_dark_desc: No natural light seems to exist here.
portal_spire_conquest: The %0 has been defeated; you have cleared floor %1.
portal_spire_conquest_stone: You have found a %0 Blood Stone.
portal_mech_chassis_wheel_desc: A mech that uses traditional wheels for locomotion.
portal_mech_chassis_tread_desc: A mech that uses treads for locomotion.
portal_mech_chassis_biped_desc: A bipedal mech designed to walk upright.
portal_mech_chassis_spider_desc: A spider-mech design using eight legs.
portal_mech_chassis_hover_desc: A mech which glides over the terrain by hovering.
portal_mech_size_small_desc: Scout-class mech with limited firepower. Not very powerful, but they help larger mechs navigate terrain.
portal_mech_size_medium_desc: Standard-sized mechs are often the most versatile, being adaptable to any role.
portal_mech_size_large_desc: Heavy mechs are often deployed to counter serious threats; they are costly and slow-moving but powerful.
portal_mech_size_titan_desc: Titan-class mechs are gigantic; although often considered impractical, their massive size allows them to dominate the field.
portal_mech_size_collector_desc: Collector mechs search for usable resources. They do not aid in combat.
portal_mech_weapon_laser_desc: Laser weapons fire intense bursts of light to burn targets at long distances.
portal_mech_weapon_flame_desc: Flamethrowers fire jets of ignited flammable liquids at targets. They are most effective at close range.
portal_mech_weapon_plasma_desc: A plasma cutter slices into enemy targets using highly charged particles at medium distances.
portal_mech_weapon_kinetic_desc: Machine guns are traditional kinetic weapons that fire a high volume of metal slugs at a target.
portal_mech_weapon_missile_desc: Missiles can track targets at long distances and blast large areas.
portal_mech_weapon_sonic_desc: Sonic weaponry creates intense vibrations to shake a target apart.
portal_mech_weapon_shotgun_desc: Shotguns fire a spread of projectiles at a target; they are devastating at close range.
