portal_mech_weapon_tesla_desc: The Tesla cannon discharges high voltage at a target; it's basically a lightning gun.
portal_mech_equip_shields_desc: Energy shields can protect a mech from a variety of threats.
portal_mech_equip_sonar_desc: Sonar can allow a mech to navigate unimpeded in environments that limit normal vision.
portal_mech_equip_grapple_desc: A grappling hook can be used to help a robot transverse otherwise impassable terrain obstacles.
portal_mech_equip_infrared_desc: Infrared sensors aid mechs operating in low-light environments.
portal_mech_equip_flare_desc: Flares can be used for a variety of purposes, from illuminating dark areas to signalling allies.
portal_mech_equip_radiator_desc: A radiator to generate heat can stop a mech from freezing up in cold-weather environments.
portal_mech_equip_coolant_desc: Extra coolant can prevent a mech from overheating in hot environments.
portal_mech_equip_stabilizer_desc: The stabilizer will help prevent unstable ground from slowing down a mech.
portal_mech_equip_seals_desc: Rubber seals can help keep sensitive equipment clean and operating efficiently.
portal_mech_equip_jumpjet_desc: Jump Jets are thrusters that help a mech "jump", increasing its mobility.
portal_mech_equip_battery_desc: An extra battery pack improves the mech's reserve power.
portal_mech_equip_target_desc: A targeting computer increases weapon effetiveness when using suboptimal weapons against a target.
portal_mech_scrap_refund: Scrap for %0 Supply and %1 Soul Gems
portal_oven_desc2: The recipe is incomplete, where could the rest be hidden?
portal_oven_effect1: Construct a part of the Cooker
portal_dish_soul_steeper_desc: Consumes the souls of powerful foes to aid the creation of the Devilish Dish.
portal_dish_soul_steeper_effect1: Dish speed +5% per spire floor cleared.
portal_dish_soul_steeper_flair: Who knew boiling infernal souls could have such flavor?
portal_dish_life_infuser_desc: Infuse the dish with the lifeforce of your own.
portal_devilish_dish_flavor0: It has not begun yet, what are you waiting for?
eden_purify_well_msg: You've discovered a well of pure water on floor %0. It radiates holy energy.
eden_asphodel_hostile: Hostile creatures have started to harrass your operations in the asphodel meadows.
eden_asphodel_desc: Open fields stretch as far as can be seen. Ghostly flowers seem to grow here and a strange sense of demotivating mediocracy permeates this place.
eden_asphodel_desc_peaceful: Translucent wispy looking bipedal creatures roam about who seem to largely ignore you.
eden_asphodel_desc_hostile: The ghostly denizens barely react to you, but hostile creatures cloaked in shadows attack you on sight.
eden_survery_meadows_action: This place fills you with a feeling that you are being watched and don't belong here. Large numbers of unremarkable souls seem to roam this place aimlessly; you have also picked samples of the ghost flower for analysis.
eden_rune_gate_effect: Construct a portal to the unknown divine.
eden_elysium_desc: Idyllic plains seem to extend forever in all directions. An aura of contentment radiates from this place.
eden_survey_fields_msg: You attempt to scout the fields but are immediately repelled by formidable angelic agents. The area is quite well fortified against intrusion containing a fortress and many angelic patrols.
eden_siege_fortress_effect: Attempt to lay waste to the fortress.
eden_siege_fortress_success: You successfully inflicted %0% damage to the fortress.
eden_raid_supplies_effect: Attempt to disrupt the fortress supply lines.
eden_raid_fortress_success: You successfully disrupted fortress readiness by %0%.
eden_ambush_patrol_effect: Attempt to ambush an enemy patrol.
eden_ambush_patrol_success: You have successfully wiped out an enemy patrol.
eden_ambush_patrol_fail: Your attempt to wipe out an enemy patrol ended in defeat.
eden_scout_elysium_effect: Send scouts deep into the Elysium Fields to find out what is out there.
eden_scout_elysium_result: The area directly around the fallen fortress has been pacified, but you discover a giant clear lake some distance away and as you get closer to it enemy resistance increases dramatically. Half your expedition force was lost while scouting.
eden_isle_desc: A massive paradisian island surrounded by pure crystal clear water.
eden_rushmore_flair: They captured your good side perfectly.
eden_reincarnation_flair: Recycled souls are just as good as new ones.
eden_spirit_vacuum_flair: She's gone from suck to blow!
eden_soul_compactor_flair: I don’t always mug god. But when I do, I do it for pocket change.
eden_palace_desc: The Palace of Eternity is a spectacular structure on the Isle of the Blessed that radiates such intense divine energy that you can't even approach it.
eden_palace_sup: The Palace of Eternity is a structure on the Isle of the Blessed that seems to be the focal point of the heavens.
eden_scout_palace_result: The angelic creatures that previously guarded this place seem to be gone. A majestic looking dead creature sits on the throne. You're not sure how it died but you are probably responsible. The corpse radiates intense divine energy.
eden_tomb_constuct: Contruct the Tomb of the Dead God
eden_tomb_effect: Contains the body of an unknown deity
eden_tomb_flair: Just roll a boulder in front of it.
eden_conduit_effect: Create a conduit between the tomb and the throne to drain the energy
eden_conduit_flair: Ok, it's a high tech extension cord.
eden_infuser_effect: Infuse whoever sits on the throne with divine powers
fortress_threat: %0 demonic creatures have been spotted in the vicinity.
fortress_threat_high: Surveyors will not live long with this much activity.
fortress_threat_medium: Although dangerous, surveyors should be able to operate without too many casualties.
fortress_threat_low: Surveyors should rarely be killed with the current level of activity.
fortress_stationed: Number of soldiers stationed at the fortress.
fortress_sieged: Your fortress was besieged by demonic creatures. The attack was repelled. %0 demons were killed, but the walls lost %1% integrity.
fortress_lost: Your fortress was overrun by demonic creatures. All the soldiers and surveyors working there were killed.
fortress_patrol_killed: A patrol was wiped out; all %0 soldiers were killed.
fortress_patrol_casualties_revive: Your patrols suffered %0 casualties, but %1 soldiers revived.
fortress_killed: A surveyor was killed by demonic creatures.
fortress_eviscerated: %0 surveyors were eviscerated by demonic creatures.
hell_observation_tooltip: Go to the hell observations panel. All activity that occurs each day in the Hell Dimension is logged and compiled here.
hell_report_log_tooltip: A report log is made at the end of each game day and logs all the events that happened in hell in chronological order. For storage/loading reasons they are not saved on refresh, and at most the past %0 logs will be kept.
hell_report_log_start: There are an estimated %0 demons around the Fortress.
hell_report_log_encounter: %0 found and killed %1 demons around the Fortress.
hell_report_log_encounter_fail: %0 failed to find any demons today.
hell_report_log_patrol_ambush: %0 got ambushed by demons and killed %1 of them.
hell_report_log_patrol_casualties: %0 soldiers were wounded and %1 were killed.
hell_report_log_soul_find: %1 %0 was found from killing the demons.
hell_report_log_soul_search: %1 %0 was found on a dead demon.
hell_report_log_patrols_lost: %0 patrol(s) got disbanded due to lack of available soldiers.
hell_report_log_siege: The fortress was attacked and destroyed in a siege by demons, causing surveyor losses of %0 and soldier losses of %1. %2 demons were killed in retaliation.
hell_report_log_siege_fail: Demons attempted a failed siege on the fortress, damaging the walls by %0%. %1 demons were killed in retaliation.
hell_report_log_demons: %0 new demons were spotted around the fortress.
hell_report_log_surveyors: 1 surveyor was killed by roaming demons.
hell_report_log_surveyors_plural: %0 surveyors were killed by roaming demons.
hell_report_log_soul_attractors: Soul Attractors drew %0 souls into the Soul Forge.
hell_report_log_ghost_trappers: Ghost Trappers exported %0 souls into the Soul Forge.
hell_report_log_soul_forge: Soul Forge guards killed %0 demons around The Pit.
hell_report_log_soul_craft: The Soul Forge accumulated enough souls and created a %0.
hell_graph_error_data_missing: Error: No data has been chosen.
outer_syndicate: A growing criminal organization known as the %0 has begun raiding your ships. They can no longer be ignored; you must begin militarizing space to protect against pirates.
outer_shipyard_park: Ships parked at %0 are out of service and require no crew or fuel.
outer_shipyard_class_corvette_desc: Corvette-class ships are the smallest and cheapest. They are usually used as scouts.
outer_shipyard_class_frigate_desc: Frigate-class ships are still small, fast, and maneuverable, but are larger and more heavily armed than Corvettes. They are usually used as quick assault ships.
outer_shipyard_class_destroyer_desc: Destroyers are medium-sized ships that pack serious firepower. They are often used as enforcers, bringing a balance between firepower, cost, and speed.
outer_shipyard_class_cruiser_desc: Cruisers are large ships that are typically stationed in a sector as a deterrent against attack. They are often used as command ships.
outer_shipyard_class_battlecruiser_desc: Battlecruisers are super-heavy cruisers that serve the purpose of crushing enemy forces with overwhelming force. They are typically deployed as flagships for entire fleets.
outer_shipyard_class_dreadnought_desc: Dreadnoughts are enormous ships that are typically considered impractical. They often have enough firepower and armor to wipe out entire fleets of enemy ships.
outer_shipyard_class_explorer_desc: The Explorer class ship is a special craft designed to house the EmDrive. This ship is specially designed to cross the interstellar void.
outer_shipyard_engine_ion_desc: The Ion Engine is a basic propulsion technology that is cheap and efficient at moving spaceships.
outer_shipyard_engine_tie_desc: The Twin Ion Engine is a dual-mounted version of the basic Ion Engine. Twice the drives, twice the thrust.
outer_shipyard_engine_pulse_desc: The Pulse Drive creates a rapid series of tiny explosions to accelerate.
outer_shipyard_engine_photon_desc: The Photon Drive is an advanced ship drive that generates a stream of photons to propel the craft.
outer_shipyard_engine_vacuum_desc: The Vacuum Drive uses advanced physics to manipulate space to move the ship.
outer_shipyard_engine_emdrive_desc: The EmDrive is an advanced engine that can reach near light speed, it requires a specially designed ship.
outer_shipyard_weapon_railgun_desc: Railguns are an effective weapon that uses minimal power.
outer_shipyard_weapon_laser_desc: Laser weapons fire a continous stream of light at a target; they use a lot of energy but are highly accurate.
outer_shipyard_weapon_p_laser_desc: Pulse Lasers fire intense bursts of energy; they are like the machine gun version of a laser.
outer_shipyard_weapon_plasma_desc: Plasma Beams are less effective over long ranges than lasers, but they are more destructive.
outer_shipyard_weapon_phaser_desc: The Phaser is a pulsed directional energy weapon; it uses a lot of energy but is highly destructive.
outer_shipyard_weapon_disruptor_desc: Disruptors fire intense cosmic rays at a target, causing damage at the molecular level.
outer_shipyard_power_solar_desc: Solar Arrays require no fuel upkeep, but they don't generate a lot of power.
outer_shipyard_power_diesel_desc: Diesel Generators run on Oil and are reliable, but they don't have a high output and are not suitable for large ships.
outer_shipyard_power_fission_desc: Fission power plants generate a lot of power, but consume Uranium.
outer_shipyard_power_fusion_desc: Fusion generators are clean and efficient, but consume large amounts of Helium-3.
outer_shipyard_power_elerium_desc: Elerium generators have unmatched output, but require use of Elerium as a fuel.
outer_shipyard_sensor_visual_desc: Ship will rely on visual sightings only to find targets.
outer_shipyard_sensor_radar_desc: Radar systems are used to find enemy ships.
outer_shipyard_sensor_lidar_desc: Long-range Lidar systems are used to locate enemy ships.
outer_shipyard_sensor_quantum_desc: An advanced Quantum Scanner is used to find enemy targets.
tau_scan: Your ship, the %0, has arrived in Tau Ceti and has begun surveying the system. The system contains 4 inner rocky planets and 4 outer gas giants.
tau_star: The star %0. It is a G Type star with about 78% of the total mass of the %1.
tau_star_goe_facility_effect: Cloning facility constructed on the Ringworld which will create more of your species from stored DNA samples and allow you to populate the Tau Ceti system.
tau_home: New %0 is the 3rd-closest planet to the star Tau Ceti, it is at the inner edge of the habitable zone at 0.5 AU.
tau_new_mission_effect: Survey the planet New %0 for resources and colony sites.
tau_home_mission_result: Several sites of interest have been mapped on the surface of New %0. Locations for mining efforts, a prime location for a colony, and what appears to be a long-abandoned alien outpost have been marked for exploitation.
tau_home_dismantle_effect: Dismantle the %0 and use its resources to establish a colony.
tau_home_excavate_msg: Now that the outpost has been fully excavated, it can be researched to learn its functions.
tau_home_tau_factory_effect: Manufacture new materials from old materials. Each Factory has %0 production lines.
tau_jump_gate_effect: Jump Gates allow travel at 100 times the speed of light between two connected gates. For nearby star systems this effectively connects them, allowing them to share resources. Requires two paired gates to be of any use.
tau_red: New %0 is the 4th-closest planet to the star Tau Ceti. It is on the outer edge of the habitable zone, at 1.24 AU.
tau_red_mission_result: A site for a colony has been found on the surface of New %0. The climate here isn't idyllic for your species, but it is perfectly habitable.
tau_red_orbital_platform_msg: While constructing your first orbital platform around %0 you observed a less advanced species of weasel-like creatures who seem to inhabit this planet. Perhaps the alien research facility on %1 has records on them.
tau_red_contact_effect: Contact the Womlings on your own.
tau_red_introduce_effect: Have Jeff introduce you to the Womlings.
tau_red_subjugate_effect: Prepare a show of force to intimidate the Womlings into submission.
tau_red_womling_mine_effect_a: Employs Womlings to mine precious %0 for you.
tau_red_womling_mine_effect_b: Employs Womlings to mine %0, %1, & %2 for you.
tau_red_womling_mine_effect_c: Employs Womlings to mine %0, %1, %2, %3, %4, %5, %6, & %7 for you.
tau_red_womling_mine_flair: No need to burn down any trees
tau_red_womling_advancement: The Womlings have advanced to tech level %0.
tau_gas_desc: A gas giant located 5.6 AU from the local star. It is a great source for fuel.
tau_gas_contest_effect: Ask your people for name suggestions for the Gas Giant. You'll then pick a winner from the top voted entries.
tau_gas_contest_effect_alt: Ask the Womlings for name suggestions for the Gas Giant. You'll then pick a winner from the top voted entries.
tau_gas_contest_reject: Reject all the names because they are terrible; keep calling it %0.
tau_gas2_desc: A gas giant located 8.2 AU from the local star. It is a lot smaller than %0 but it still the 2nd largest planet in the system.
tau_gas2_contest_effect: Run another contest to name the outermost planet of the Tau Ceti system.
tau_gas2_contest_flair: Surely you'll get better names this time... right?
tau_gas2_contest_reject: Never again; call it %0 out of spite.
tau_gas2_alien_station_repair_effect: You've detected a powered-down space station in orbit around %0. You should send a survey team to it.
tau_gas2_alien_station_msg: You've surveyed the abandoned space station around %0. You'll have to make major repairs to get it operational again.
tau_gas2_alien_station_data1: You've discovered extensive genetic information about the %0 in the alien data.
tau_gas2_alien_station_data2: You've discovered a recipe for %0 in the alien data.
tau_gas2_alien_station_data3: You've discovered advancements in the alien data that can be exploited by your civilization.
tau_gas2_alien_station_data4: You've discovered a new type of %0 in the alien data.
tau_gas2_alien_station_data5: You've deciphered additional technological advancements in the alien data.
tau_gas2_alien_station_data6: You've discovered research in the alien data for how to construct a Matrioshka Brain around an artificial sun.
tau_gas2_alien_station_data6_alt: You've discovered research in the alien data for how to construct a Ringworld powered by the sun.
tau_gas2_ignite_gas_giant_effect: Ignite the gas giant to power on the %0.
tau_gas2_ignite_gas_giant_effect3: Retire and let the super computer run the colony.
tau_roid_desc: A debris disc encompasses the outer area of the local star system, ranging from 10 AU to 55 AU. Mining prospects make it an attractive area for development.
tau_roid_mission_effect: Launch a series of probes to scout the %0.
tau_roid_mission_result: Many mineral rich sites have been detected, but several of your probes were destroyed by aggressive space creatures.
tau_roid_patrol_ship_effect: Each patrol ship can protect one of your asteroid belt interests. You can have more interests than you can safely guard, but they will suffer penalties if you don't have enough ships to patrol all your sectors.
tau_plague: News has reached you that the %0 has quarantined one of their cities due to an outbreak of a new disease.
tau_plague2: Reports of the %0 plague are starting to appear all over the homeworld. Quarantine measures have been enacted to contain it while a cure is researched.
tau_plague3: Cases of the %0 plague are being reported all over the %1 system.
tau_plague4: A growing faction thinks you should shut down the Jump Gate to preserve the %0 colony.
tau_plague5b: All transmissions from the %0 system have stopped. The last messages received indicate widespread chaos and disorder.
universe_standard_desc: A standard universe with normal laws of physics
universe_standard_effect: This is a vanilla universe; no special rules apply.
universe_heavy_desc: The force of gravity in this universe is much stronger than normal
universe_heavy_effect: Transportation fuel costs will be much higher in this universe, but prestige resources earned from non-MAD resets are increased by %0% plus an extra %0% for each active Challenge Gene.
universe_antimatter_desc: This universe consists primarily of antimatter
universe_antimatter_effect: Weaker Anti-Plasmids replace Plasmids. Temples always give faith and boost Anti-Plasmid storage effects.
universe_evil_desc: Everything in this universe is evil
universe_evil_effect: If Evil is normal and normal is Evil, is evil 'evil' anymore?
universe_micro_desc: Everything in this universe is small
universe_micro_effect: Everything in this universe is cheaper. However, all prestige resource gains are reduced by %0%. Only micro universe achievements can be earned.
universe_magic_desc: Magic is real in this universe
universe_magic_effect: In this universe, real magic exists. It is a force just like any other to be harnessed and exploited.
genelab_genus_humanoid_desc: Humanoids are your standard bipedal creatures that are typically between 1.5-2 meters in height.
genelab_genus_carnivore_desc: Carnivorous Beasts are anthropomorphic creatures with a dietary preference for meat.
genelab_genus_herbivore_desc: Herbivorous Beasts are anthropomorphic creatures with a dietary preference for plants.
genelab_genus_omnivore_desc: Omnivorous Beasts are anthropomorphic creatures that will eat anything.
genelab_genus_small_desc: Small Humanoids are similar to regular humanoids in appearance but are usually around half the height.
genelab_genus_giant_desc: Giant Humanoids are similar to regular humanoids in appearance but are larger, typically exceeding 3 meters in height.
genelab_genus_reptilian_desc: Reptilians are cold-blooded creatures that evolved from reptiles.
genelab_genus_avian_desc: Avians are flying creatures that evolved from various types of birds.
genelab_genus_insectoid_desc: Insectoids are creatures that evolved from insect or arachnid species.
genelab_genus_plant_desc: These are creatures that have evolved from plants into a sentient and mobile species.
genelab_genus_fungi_desc: These are creatures that have evolved from fungi into a sentient and mobile species.
genelab_genus_aquatic_desc: Aquatic races evolved in the ocean and prefer water environments but can move on land.
genelab_genus_fey_desc: Fey races are mystical in nature and prefer forest environments.
genelab_genus_heat_desc: Heat races have high tolerence to hot environments and hate the cold.
genelab_genus_polar_desc: Polar races have high tolerence to cold environments and hate the heat.
genelab_genus_sand_desc: Sand races envolved in desert environments and prefer them to more lush landscapes.
genelab_genus_demonic_desc: Demonic creatures love hellish landscapes and prefer not to live in lush green places.
genelab_genus_angelic_desc: Angelic creatures love pristine landscapes and find anything less to be unsuitable.
genelab_genus_synthetic_desc: Synthetic creatures were made by another race, usually as servants, before gaining independance.
genelab_genus_eldritch_desc: Eldritch creatures are nightmarish horrors that live in subterranean cities. They often raid the surface world for thralls and resources.
genelab_genus_hybrid_desc: This species is a blend of two genus.
events_halloween_lumberjack: What the heck kind of forest is this?
wiki_main_spoiler: The contents contained in this wiki will spoil the game. Proceed only if you do not wish to discover everything for yourself.
wiki_main_blurb: Evolve Incremental is a web-based game about first evolving a species from primordial ooze into a sentient species, then guiding that new species into a mighty civilization that will eventually take to the stars and colonize space.
wiki_main_contribution: Special thanks to %0 for their contributions to the game.
wiki_faq_q_update: How do I update to the new version once an update is released?
wiki_faq_a_update: A notification will show in the top bar if an update is available. Simply refresh the page to update. You can press CTRL + F5 to reload the cache to ensure you have the new content. The game maintains backwards compatibility with older save files.
wiki_faq_q_hotkeys: What are the hotkeys for multipliers?
wiki_faq_a_hotkeys: You can hold these hotkeys to increase the amount of clicks on certain buttons: Ctrl = 10x, Shift = 25x, Alt = 100x. You can combine hotkeys; Ctrl + Alt = 1000x.
wiki_faq_a_sethotkeys: Yes, these can be set to a custom key in the settings tab.
wiki_faq_q_offline: Can I play this game offline?
wiki_faq_a_offline: No, but after you load the page it will work without Internet until the page is refreshed.
wiki_faq_q_moonphase: How long are moon phases, cycles and days?
wiki_faq_a_moonphase: A moon phase is a cycle. Cycles are 28 in-game days or 140 real seconds. Days are 5 real seconds.
wiki_faq_a_orbital: If you hover over the name of the planet on the top-left, it states the orbital period of your current planet. The default period is 365 days. The orbital period changes the length of seasons, and thus the weather and temperature at certain times.
wiki_faq_a_lumber: If you are an Ent or Dryad, Lumber is disabled and all other building costs that would require Lumber are increased by 5% to compensate.
wiki_faq_q_farm: Why is the agriculture technology and the farm missing?
wiki_faq_a_farm: If you have the Carnivore trait, agriculture is disabled. Carnivores gain food from hunters instead.
wiki_faq_a_steel: After building a Barracks, Steel can be stolen from rivals with the “launch campaign” mechanic on the Civics tab. Alternatively, there is a small chance to discover it from active trade routes. After discovering it, you can trade for it. You can produce it at the Smelter after researching the Crucible Steel technology.
wiki_faq_a_aluminium: Build a Metal Refinery and have active Quarry Workers.
wiki_faq_a_titanium: You must trade for it until you have enough to afford the Hunter Process technology to produce it yourself.
wiki_faq_q_titanium_balorg: How do I get Titanium if I am playing Balorg?
wiki_faq_a_titanium_balorg: Because Balorg can't trade, they can instead loot titanium from combat, though not from ambushes.
wiki_faq_a_polymer: Building a Factory reveals these materials in the trade menu, and they can be produced at the Factory through the Industry tab. Polymer requires the Polymer technology.
wiki_faq_a_mythril: Crafting, with Iridium and Alloy after building the Iridium Mine on the Moon.
wiki_faq_a_infernite: Build Surveyor Carports in the Hell Dimension and assign Surveyor jobs to your citizens. Surveyors must be protected by patrols.
wiki_faq_a_stanene: Stanene is produced by Factories, after researching Stanene.
wiki_faq_q_crates: How do I use crates and containers?
wiki_faq_a_crates: Freight Yards give Crates and Container Ports give Containers. Crates can quickly be moved by clicking the + symbol next to a resource. This will open up a menu that will let you construct, assign, or unassign crates/containers to that resource. They cost resources to build but can be freely moved around. Multiplier keys can be used to build or move more than one at a time. Alternatively, use the better GUI under Resources -> Storage.
wiki_faq_a_soft_reset: Soft-resetting is used to reset your game back to the evolution stage before reaching a prestige point. However, you will receive no benefit from soft-resetting.
wiki_faq_a_hard_reset: A hard reset permanently deletes all your save data. You should back up your save string before doing this!
wiki_faq_q_combat: How does the combat system function?
wiki_faq_a_combat: The more soldiers you send into combat, the more that can die. Thus, the goal is to send as few as possible while still winning most of the time. Generally, attack with as few soldiers as possible while maintaining a 50% advantage.
wiki_faq_q_morale: What is the effect of morale?
wiki_faq_a_morale: Every 1% above 100% morale increases global production by 0.5%. Every 1% below 100% decreases global production by 1%.
wiki_faq_a_stress: Job stress, unemployment, weather, temperature, taxes, warmonger status, and entertainment. Job stress increases with population size and cannot be lowered without the Content gene. Different races receive varying buffs or debuffs from certain weather or temperatures. Every 1% above 20% tax decreases morale by 1% up to 40%, and then every 1% above 40% tax decreases morale by 1.5%. Taxes rates below 20% increase morale by 1%. Every 2% below 21% taxes increases max morale by 1%. Warmonger is a temporary morale penalty when sending soldiers on a campaign. Entertainer jobs from the Amphitheatre and various buildings later in the game provide positive morale.
wiki_faq_a_genetic_decay: Genetic decay reduces the number of active Plasmids. However, it takes a very very long time to reach decay, so you shouldn't worry about it.
wiki_faq_a_cache: It gives a quantity of iron, copper, steel, and cement equal to a random number between 1% and 25% of your total storage capacity for each material.
wiki_faq_q_aphrodisiac: What is the effect of the Aphrodisiac technology?
wiki_faq_a_aphrodisiac: It decreases the time needed for a new citizen to grow.
wiki_faq_a_religion: Religion is part of the prestige system. You cannot see it unless you have prestiged at least once.
wiki_faq_a_tax_riots: Tax revolts have a chance to trigger if taxes are greater than 25% and morale is less than 100%.
wiki_faq_q_race: What governs which race I get in each genus tree during the evolution stage?
wiki_faq_a_race: You can choose to evolve as any race which has completed the MAD reset. MAD resetting as 25 unique races unlocks ability to choose any race on MAD reset. The second and third resets allow you to choose any race for the next run. Without the above, the outcome is randomly seeded. Each game assigns a random seed that governs the outcome. Because it is seeded, you will always get the same race if you export your save and then import it before you made the choice, since the seed is the same.
wiki_faq_q_weather: What is the effect of weather?
wiki_faq_a_weather: Weather effects vary per species. Consult the Species page for weather effects, and consult the Planets page for specific weather rules per planet/season.
wiki_faq_a_sundial: The Sundial is the base knowledge income. +1 base, +1 after first MAD reset on the current planet, +1 after Euthanasia Perk, +1 on Magnetic planets.
wiki_faq_q_stoned: What is the "-10% stoned" production penalty?
wiki_faq_a_stoned: The Mellow Planetary Modifier gives this penalty, but also reduces stress.
wiki_faq_a_plasmid: Plasmids are the first prestige resource; all prestige options award Plasmids. They boost production and can be used to buy permanent upgrades from the CRISPR tab.
wiki_faq_q_plasmid_keep: How many Plasmids should I keep?
wiki_faq_a_plasmid_keep: The soft cap for Plasmids is 250 + Phage count. If you are using the "No Plasmids" challenge gene, however, you may want to just spend them all.
wiki_faq_q_plasmid_earn: What determines the amount of Plasmids I earn?
wiki_faq_a_plasmid_earn: A combination of your living population and the amount of Knowledge you have spent. Soldiers count as population for this purpose.
wiki_faq_a_crispr: They are permanent buffs that apply to all subsequent playthroughs. Sequencing the genome of your race reveals a new CRISPR tab.
wiki_faq_a_creep: It reduces the scaling cost of buildings.
wiki_faq_a_phage: Phage is the second prestige resource. It is awarded from all reset points other than Mutual Destruction.
wiki_faq_q_phage_earn: What determines the amount of Phage I earn?
wiki_faq_a_phage_earn: Phage earned is tied to the number of Plasmids earned.
wiki_faq_q_phage_benefit: What is the benefit of Phage?
wiki_faq_a_phage_benefit: Phage increases the diminishing return cap on Plasmids by the amount of Phage. There is no cap on Phage.
wiki_faq_a_anti_plasmids: If you are in the Antimatter universe, any mechanic that would normally give Plasmids will give Anti-Plasmids instead.
wiki_faq_q_temple: What is the difference between Anthropology and Fanaticism?
wiki_faq_a_temple: They open different tech trees. Anthropology tends to be better for shorter games, while Fanaticism is better for longer games. Anthropology gives a flat bonus to Temples and unique technologies to buff Knowledge and money. Fanaticism gives a scaling bonus to Temples and unique bonuses to trade and combat; it also gives you the main trait of your ancestor species.
wiki_faq_q_temple_break: When does the scaling Fanaticism Temple bonus break even with Anthropology?
wiki_faq_a_temple_break: You need 15 Professors to make Fanaticism break even with Anthropology.
wiki_faq_q_demonic: How do I play as the Demonic races?
wiki_faq_a_demonic: You must earn the Doomed achievement to unlock Hellscape planets.
wiki_faq_q_celestial: How do I play as the Celestial races?
wiki_faq_a_celestial: Celestial races replace demonic races inside the Evil Universe. These also require having earned Doomed to unlock.
wiki_faq_a_mastery: Mastery is a production bonus earned from completing achievements. It requires unlocking first through CRISPR.
wiki_faq_a_challenges: Buy the Hardened Gene CRISPR upgrade. Playing with Challenges give more Prestige resources when resetting. It also unlocks higher-tier achievements which award more Mastery.
wiki_faq_a_perks: Perks are permanent bonuses earned from completing specific achievements.
wiki_faq_a_feats: Feats are difficult achievements intended only for completionists. Unlike Perks and normal achievements, they offer no reward.
wiki_faq_a_support: Support is a special type of power found on various space buildings. It is used to power buildings in the same category.
wiki_faq_q_micro: Can achievements be earned in the Micro universe?
wiki_faq_a_micro: Only Micro achievements can be earned for Mastery in the Micro universe. Other achievements will unlock only the Micro icon and offer no general Mastery.
wiki_faq_q_valdi: What happens if I use Fanaticism after doing the Genetic Dead End (Valdi) challenge?
wiki_faq_a_valdi: You get a random minor positive trait instead of all the negative traits.
wiki_faq_q_quantum: What does the Quantum level effect?
wiki_faq_a_quantum: Swarm Satellite cost reduction from Swarm Plants, Factory production bonus from Quantum Manufacturing technology, Warehouse storage bonus from Cargo Yards, and the Interstellar Citadel.
wiki_faq_q_quantum_level: How is the Quantum level calculated?
wiki_faq_q_exotic: Which resources count as Exotic Mass for the Mass Ejector?
wiki_faq_q_soul_gem: How do I get Soul Gems?
wiki_faq_a_soul_gem: Hell patrols have a small chance to find a Soul Gem on each encounter. Run more patrols to increase your odds of finding Soul Gems.
wiki_faq_q_soul_gem_spend: How should I spend my first Soul Gem?
wiki_faq_a_soul_gem_spend: Buy the Virtual Reality tech. Dozens of techs are gated behind it that do not require Soul Gems.
wiki_faq_q_hell_patrol: My patrols in the Hell Dimension die too quickly to replace; what do I do?
wiki_faq_a_hell_patrol: When you first enter Hell, devote all your soldiers to large patrol sizes. It will reduce the Demonic threat level without taking many losses. Then, gradually reduce the size into more patrols. Ideally, balance it so that you can have as many patrols as you can reinforce, since more patrols are better if you can support the reinforcement rate.
wiki_faq_q_surveyors: How do I keep my Surveyors from dying?
wiki_faq_a_surveyors: Reduce the demonic threat level by increasing your patrols. If the threat is higher than 1500, Surveyors will die too often to be effective.
wiki_faq_q_defense: How much defense rating should the fortress have?
wiki_faq_a_defense: The demon attack strength scales to their threat rating. Hold them at less than 1500 and have a defense rating of at least 600. ~800 is very safe.
wiki_faq_q_infusion: What is the difference between Exotic Infusion and Stabilize Black Hole?
wiki_faq_a_infusion: After reaching 0.025 Solar Masses of Exotic Mass in the hole, it unlocks a research option to stabilize or infuse it. Exotic Infusion triggers the Black Hole reset, while Stabilize Black Hole destroys all Exotic Mass in the black hole, converting it into regular mass at a 1:40 ratio. Stabilize is used to pump up the energy generated.
wiki_faq_q_dark_energy: What determines the amount of Dark Energy I receive?
wiki_faq_a_dark_energy: The amount of Mass and Exotic Mass in the hole, according to this formula: (LN(1 + (exotic mass * 40))) + (log2(mass - 7)/2.5)).
wiki_basics_start_para1: Evolve is a civilization-building game; the goal is to develop your species into the best it can be.
wiki_basics_start_para2: This guide will give an overview of the gameplay basics. If you wish to discover things for yourself, then you should stop reading.
wiki_basics_prehistoric_para1: Before you can start conquering the world, you must first evolve into a sentient species.
wiki_basics_prehistoric_para2: This first phase of the game allows you to guide evolution towards a genus of your choosing.
wiki_basics_prehistoric_para3: There are two resources in this phase of the game: %0 and %1.
wiki_basics_prehistoric_para4: %0 will passively generate %1, and %2 will generate %3.
wiki_basics_prehistoric_para5: Increase your resource capacities by constructing %0, %1, or %2.
wiki_basics_prehistoric_para6: Many of the techs will warn you that you are at an evolutionary fork; this is a decision you are making that will effect the outcome of evolution.
wiki_basics_prehistoric_para7: Each fork diverts your path towards a %0. Once a genus is picked, it is locked in for the current game run.
wiki_basics_prehistoric_para8: Each basic genus has %0 possible species outcomes.
wiki_basics_prehistoric_para9: Each genus has unique genus-level traits shared by all its potential species, and each species has traits that are unique to that species.
wiki_basics_prehistoric_para10: Some of these traits can drastically alter gameplay.
wiki_basics_prehistoric_para11: You should not overthink your choice here, as you will have the opportunity to play other races down the line.
wiki_basics_prehistoric_para12: New players often ask what race is best; there is no one best race. They are all different, but no race is strictly better or worse than other races.
wiki_basics_prehistoric_para13: When you reach %0, that will end this phase of the game, giving you a random race from the genus type you have chosen.
wiki_basics_prehistoric_para14: There is no point to overbuilding during this phase of the game, as it will not carry over into the next phase.
wiki_basics_civilization_para1: After you have evolved into a sentient species you can begin to build your civilization.
wiki_basics_civilization_para2: The first thing you will need to do is construct some housing and get some citizens.
wiki_basics_civilization_para3: Citizens are the workforce of your city; you can manage what jobs they are assigned to on the %0 tab.
wiki_basics_civilization_para4: You will want to assign your first citizen to gather %0. Depending on your species, that will either be the %1 or %2 job.
wiki_basics_civilization_para5: The job with an %0 after it is the default job; new citizens will automatically be assigned to the default job.
wiki_basics_civilization_para6: You can change the default job by clicking on another job in the civics tab.
wiki_basics_civilization_para7: You can only assign default job status to the basic job types (those with no cap on them).
wiki_basics_civilization_para8: The earliest challenge is getting enough %0 income to keep your people fed.
wiki_basics_civilization_para9: If you run out of %0, you will go into a %1 state which lowers production.
wiki_basics_civilization_para10: If the amount of %0 you are producing is significantly below your required consumption, then people will starve to death.
wiki_basics_civilization_para11: Increase your %0 storage limit to help cover periods of reduced production, such as cold weather.
wiki_basics_civilization_para12: You will also want to focus early on any technologies that help with %0 production, so you can shift population to other tasks.
wiki_basics_civilization_para13: The primary barrier to progress is %0. Increasing your maximum %0 so you can research more advanced technologies is the main method of advancement.
wiki_basics_civilization_para14: Your first %0-increasing building is the %1. Construct these to allow discovery of more advanced technologies.
wiki_basics_government_para1: Once you unlock %0, you will want to set one in the %1 tab to remove %2.
wiki_basics_government_para2: If you fail to set a %0, you will be in %1, which will cause a growing production penalty depending on how many citizens you have.
wiki_basics_government_para3: There is a cooldown period after changing your %0 type, after which you can change it again.
wiki_basics_government_para4: You will also want to pay attention to your %0.
wiki_basics_government_para5: High %0 (above 100%) will give you a global production bonus, while lower %0 (below 100%) will cause a production malus.
wiki_basics_government_para6: The primary method of raising your %0 is through the %1 job, and the primary method of losing %0 is from %2.
wiki_basics_government_para7: Changing your %0 will also affect %1. Higher %0 causes lower %1 and vice versa.
wiki_basics_government_para8: If you raise your taxes above %0% and have morale lower than %1% it can cause a tax riot. These are bad, so you should aim to avoid riots.
wiki_basics_mad_para1: The goal of your first playthrough should be to reach %0.
wiki_basics_mad_para2: This is a %0 option that appears on the %1 -> %2 tab once unlocked.
wiki_basics_mad_para3: If you go into %0 then you have overshot the first reset point.
wiki_basics_mad_para4: You can continue to play deeper into the game, but it is recommended you reset as soon as possible as the prestige gain is significant.
wiki_trait_fanaticism: This trait can be inherited from %0 Fanaticism/Deify
wiki_trait_effect_beast: +%0% hunting production, +%1% hunting when Windy. +%2% soldier training speed.
wiki_trait_effect_small: -%0 Planetary cost creep, -%1 Non-Homeworld cost creep.
wiki_trait_effect_weak: -%0% production to Lumberjacks, Quarry Workers, and Miners.
wiki_trait_effect_strong: %0X manual resource gains (Food, Lumber, Stone). Basic jobs are %1X more effective.
wiki_trait_effect_cold_blooded: Farmers, Hunters, Lumberjacks, Reclaimers, Quarry Workers, Miners, and Coal Miners: -%0% production when Cold or Raining, +%1% production when Hot or Sunny.
wiki_trait_effect_scales: -%0 soldier deaths on success, -%1 death on failure. +%2 Hell Patrol Armor.
wiki_trait_effect_flier: Clay replaces Stone and Cement. Clay costs reduced by %0%. +%1 Trade Post trade route.
wiki_trait_effect_flier_ex1: Cement is converted to Clay at 1.75x original Cement cost, but is then discounted by the Clay discount.
wiki_trait_effect_sky_lover: Increased stress for mining jobs by %0%.
wiki_trait_effect_high_pop: Population numbers are %0x higher, but citizens contribute only %1% of their normal work value individually. Population growth is %2x faster.
wiki_trait_effect_high_pop_ex1: The High Population trait will not be gained from using Mimic to emulate Insectoid.
wiki_trait_effect_fast_growth: Faster population growth. Growth speed scales with trait rank.
wiki_trait_effect_photosynth: -%0% food consumption when Sunny, -%1% food consumption when Cloudy, -%2% food consumption when Rainy.
wiki_trait_effect_sappy: Amber replaces Stone. Citizens and Soldiers produces %0 Amber per second, eliminating the need for Quarry Workers.
wiki_trait_effect_spores: Increased population growth when Windy. Growth speed scales with trait rank.
wiki_trait_effect_detritivore: Agriculture is replaced with composting. Base composting rate is %0 food per second.
wiki_trait_effect_elusive: Spies are never caught. Hell patrols are %0% less likely to be ambushed; effect does not combine with Chameleon.
wiki_trait_effect_smoldering: +%0% morale in Summer, No morale bonus in Spring. +%1% global production bonus for each consecutive Hot day up to 100 stacks; +%2% above 100 stacks. Lumber is not available; additional resource Chrysotile is harvested by Quarry Workers. Most resource costs are reduced by 10%.
wiki_trait_effect_cold_intolerance: -%0% global production penalty for each consecutive Cold day.
wiki_trait_effect_chilled: +%0% morale in Winter, No morale bonus in Spring. +%1% global production bonus for each consecutive Cold day up to 100 stacks; +%2% above 100 stacks. +%3% Food if Cold, +%4% Food if Snowing, -%5% Food if Sunny.
wiki_trait_effect_heat_intolerance: -%0% global production penalty for each consecutive Hot day.
wiki_trait_effect_scavenger: Scavenger job is always available (%0% production per scavenger). +%1% Scavenger effectiveness on Trashed planets.
wiki_trait_effect_immoral: Warmonger is a bonus instead of a penalty. Warmonger bonus adjusted by %0%.
wiki_trait_effect_evil: Lumber, Furs, and Plywood are replaced with Bones, Flesh, and Boneweave. Smelters can operate on Flesh instead of Lumber.
wiki_trait_effect_blissful: Production penalty from low morale is reduced to %0% of normal. No Tax Riots are possible.
wiki_trait_effect_holy: Soldiers have +%0% rating in the hell dimension. Demon Suppression is %1% easier.
wiki_trait_effect_brute: -%0% mercenaries cost and +%1% faster base soldier training.
wiki_trait_effect_curious: +%0% University knowledge per citizen. Random events caused by curiosity.
wiki_trait_effect_carnivore: Unemployed are replaced with Hunters. Agriculture tech is disabled. %0% of Food spoils each second, reduced by Smokehouses.
wiki_trait_effect_pack_mentality: +%0 Basic Housing cost creep, -%1 Medium/Large Housing cost creep.
wiki_trait_effect_playful: Hunters increase morale by %0% and cause no stress.
wiki_trait_effect_beast_of_burden: Make an extra loot roll on successful attack.
wiki_trait_effect_hooved: Expanding population requires %0. %0 costs scaled to %1%.
wiki_trait_effect_hooved_ex1: %0 materials change at various breakpoints for total acquired quantity.
wiki_trait_effect_hooved_ex3: If the next resource is not unlocked by the time you reach the breakpoint, it will keep charging the current resource but at a greatly inflated price.
wiki_trait_effect_hooved_ex4: Note that you start with %0 %1, which count against the total.
wiki_trait_effect_hooved_ex5: If %0 is not available as a resource, then %1 will be charged from the beginning.
wiki_trait_effect_rage: Wounded soldiers fight %1% harder instead of taking a penalty. Your army fights %0% harder for every wounded soldier.
wiki_trait_effect_heavy: Fuel costs are %0% higher. Some material costs %1% higher.
wiki_trait_effect_calm: Global bonus provided by zen state. %0 meditation spots per chamber.
wiki_trait_effect_herbivore: Soldiers do not produce food from hunting.
wiki_trait_effect_forager: Several basic jobs are combined into one. %0% efficency.
wiki_trait_effect_instinct: %1% dying soldiers are instead wounded. Surveyors %0% less likely to be killed. Losses from Andromeda assault missions is reduced by half. Andromeda ships better avoid pirates, reducing threat.
wiki_trait_effect_instinct_ex1: Pirate threat reduced by %0% in %1 and by %2% in other regions.
wiki_trait_effect_puny: Average combat roll reduced by 15%. -%0% Combat Rating.
wiki_trait_effect_intelligent: +%0% production per Professor, +%1% production per Scientist.
wiki_trait_effect_regenerative: Base wounded soldiers healed each day increased to %0.
wiki_trait_effect_optimistic: Stress reduced by %0 points. Minimum Morale increased by %1%.
wiki_trait_effect_chameleon: Barracks house 1 less soldier. +%0% Combat Rating. Hell patrols are %1% less likely to be ambushed; effect does not combine with Elusive.
wiki_trait_effect_selenophobia: Moon phase impacts productivity. Ranges from -%0% during full moon to +%1% during new moon.
wiki_trait_effect_leathery: Negative impact of bad weather on morale is reduced from 5 to %0.
wiki_trait_effect_solitary: -%0 Basic Housing cost creep, +%1 Medium Housing cost creep.
wiki_trait_effect_kindling_kindred: Lumber and Plywood resources removed, +%0% cost if building would normally cost Lumber or Plywood.
wiki_trait_effect_sticky: Food requirements are lowered by %0% and combat rating is increased by %1%.
wiki_trait_effect_infectious: Attacking has a chance to increase your population. Up to %0/%1/%2/%3/%4 enemies will be infected, depending on campaign type.
wiki_trait_effect_parasite: Natural population growth only occurs when it's windy. Start with 2 Soldiers.
wiki_trait_effect_toxic: +%0% Factory Money/Alloy/Polymer production. +%1% Nano Tube/Stanene production. +%2% Cement production.
wiki_trait_effect_nyctophilia: -%0% Morale when Sunny. +%1% Morale when Cloudy.
wiki_trait_effect_hibernator: Food consumption is lowered by %0% during winter, but production is also lowered by %1%.
wiki_trait_effect_infiltrator: Spies are cheaper and you occasionally steal tech advancements. Stealing is possible after reaching a knowledge cap above %0% of the tech's base cost. One fewer Scout Ship is needed to determine the threat in an area.
wiki_trait_effect_infiltrator_ex1: Stolen techs are not random and are generally stolen earlier than can be normally acquired.
wiki_trait_effect_cannibalize: Gain Sacrificial Altar. Sacrifice population for %0% boons.
wiki_trait_effect_frail: Soldier deaths increased by %0 on won fights, and by %1 on lost fights.
wiki_trait_effect_claws: Combat rating and average combat roll increased by %0%.
wiki_trait_effect_hivemind: Soldier, Lumberjack, Quarry Worker, Miner, Coal Miner, Professor, and Scientist effectiveness scales with the number of workers assigned to that job. Breaks even at %0 workers.
wiki_trait_effect_tunneler: -%0 Mine and Coal Mine cost creep.
wiki_trait_effect_blood_thirst: Frequent combat raises morale up to +%0%. Warmonger penalty is disabled.
wiki_trait_effect_apex_predator: +%0% Combat Rating. +%1% Hunting production. Armor is disabled.
wiki_trait_effect_environmentalist: Hydroelectric Dams (+4MW) and Wind Farms (+5MW-7MW depending on wind) replace Coal (+5MW) and Oil (+6MW) Powerplants. Windmill power production increased to 1.5MW.
wiki_trait_effect_musical: Entertainers increase morale by an additional %0%.
wiki_trait_effect_revive: Chance for soldiers to revive when killed. Hot temperatures increase chance of triggering effect, while cold temperatures lower it. Revive chance also scales with trait rank.
wiki_trait_effect_forge: Smelters do not require fuel and get the Oil bonus all the time. +%0MW produced by Geothermal Plants.
wiki_trait_effect_autoignition: Library Knowledge production bonus reduced by %0%.
wiki_trait_effect_blurry: Spy Missions are less likely to fail. Surveyors are %0% less likely to be killed.
wiki_trait_effect_snowy: Morale is lowered by %0 to %1 when it's not snowing.
wiki_trait_effect_ravenous: Food consumption increases with your Food stockpile. Eat %0% more food + 1/%1 of your stockpile per tick.
wiki_trait_effect_ghostly: +%0% Food from Hunting. +%1 base Food per Soul Well. +%2% Soul Gem drop rate.
wiki_trait_effect_lawless: Government lockout timer is reduced by %0%.
wiki_trait_effect_mistrustful: Hostilities grow quicker with foreign governments. +%0% extra hate gained from attacking.

wiki_trait_effect_slaver: You can capture slaves in combat, who boost your productivity by %0% each.

wiki_trait_effect_conniving: %0% better buying prices, %1% better selling prices.

Cycles with moon phase if constructed during New Moon, Full Moon, or Quarter Moon.
wiki_trait_effect_noble: Taxes cannot be raised above %1% or lowered below %0%.
wiki_trait_effect_artifical: New population doesn't grow automatically; instead they must be manufactured. Citizens assigned to science jobs are %0% more effective.
wiki_trait_effect_powered: Each citizen requires %0MW of power to remain functional; however, miner, lumberjack, and cement worker jobs are %1% more effective.

wiki_trait_effect_emotionless: Entertainers are %0% less effective, but jobs are also %1% less stressful.

wiki_trait_effect_linked: Quantum level is increased by %0% per citizen. Linked effect degrades above %1%.
wiki_trait_effect_deconstructor: Convert resources into Nanites at %0% efficiency.
wiki_trait_effect_shapeshifter: Ability to assume genus properties from other genus. Positive traits are assumed at rank %0, while negative traits are assumed at rank %1.
wiki_trait_effect_psychic: Energy Regen +%2. Psychic Effect Power +%3%. Mind Break +%0%. Thrall effectiveness +%1%.

wiki_trait_effect_living_tool: You do not need to develop basic tools like pickaxes; instead, you adapt your body to perform those functions. Gets better with scientific advancement.
wiki_trait_effect_artisan: Your mastery and love of crafting grants %0% improved crafting, %1% improved factory production, and %2% improved morale per crafter.
wiki_trait_effect_stubborn: You subbornly refuse to accept new things, increasing knowledge costs of significant scientific advancements by %0%.
wiki_trait_effect_rogue: Randomly steal a resource, up to %0% of current cap.
wiki_trait_effect_untrustworthy: Buildings that store money cost %0% more due to needing increased security measures.
wiki_trait_effect_living_materials: Self replicating living materials reduce construction costs over time for %0, %1, %2, & %3.
wiki_trait_effect_unstable: %0% chance for up to %1% of citizens to expire every day.
wiki_trait_effect_elemental_electric: You have an elemental affinity for %0. Each citizen generates %1 MW of power and your soldiers are %2% stronger.
wiki_trait_effect_elemental_acid: You have an elemental affinity for %0. Each citizen improves industrial processes by %1% and your soldiers are %2% stronger.
wiki_trait_effect_elemental_fire: You have an elemental affinity for %0. Each citizen improves smelting processes by %1% and your soldiers are %2% stronger.
wiki_trait_effect_elemental_frost: You have an elemental affinity for %0. Each citizen improves your %3 by %1% and your soldiers are %2% stronger.
wiki_trait_effect_chicken: You taste great, things want to eat you. Hell is %0% more brutal, and piracy effects are %1% worse. Unpleasant random events also occur.
wiki_trait_effect_tusk: %0% of combat rating applied as mining bonus instead of using pickaxes. Gain %1% attack power depending on moisture level of environment. Combat bonus reduced in hell.
wiki_trait_effect_blubber: Convert your own dead into Oil, %0 body per day per refinery.

wiki_achieve_canceled: Black Hole reset out of the Antimatter universe.

wiki_achieve_microbang: Black Hole reset out of the Micro universe.
wiki_achieve_pw_apocalypse: Vacuum Collapse reset out of the Magic universe.
wiki_achieve_iron_will: This achievement is awarded in stages for progress in Cataclysm mode; to get Gold rank you must Bioseed in Cataclysm.
wiki_achieve_failed_history: Do a Cataclysm reset while playing in Cataclysm mode.
wiki_achieve_banana: Complete the following objectives; each one upgrades the achievement ranking.
wiki_achieve_banana1: Conquer an enemy city by Sieging it.
wiki_achieve_banana3: Expand a black hole to 12 Solar Mass with no exotic matter in it, excluding mass from A.R.P.A.
wiki_achieve_banana4: Export %0 trade routes of a resource.
wiki_achieve_gladiator: Defeat all %0 unique boss types in the Spire.
wiki_achieve_corrupted: Defeat a Greater Demon and consume its essence.
wiki_achieve_red_dead: Blackhole or Vacuum Collapse reset without building any Spaceports.
wiki_achieve_ashanddust: Complete a Mutually Assured Destruction reset while playing on the True Path.
wiki_achieve_exodus: Complete a Bioseed reset while playing on the True Path.
wiki_achieve_obsolete: Complete an AI Apocalypse reset while playing on the True Path.
wiki_achieve_bluepill: Complete a Matrix reset while playing on the True Path.
wiki_achieve_retired: Complete a Retirement reset while playing on the True Path.
wiki_achieve_pathfinder: Complete different reset types while playing on the True Path.
wiki_achieve_overlord: Subjugate, Contact, and get Introduced to the Womlings in seperate runs that complete a tier 4 reset.
wiki_achieve_what_is_best: Complete an Apotheosis reset while playing the Warlord scenario.
wiki_achieve_traitor: Complete an Apotheosis reset with a stock celestial race.
wiki_achieve_doppelganger: Kill a spire boss with the same name as your stock base race.
wiki_feat_utopia: Get your current morale to at least 500%.
wiki_feat_take_no_advice: Complete a MAD or Cataclysm reset on a Hellscape planet while playing as any non-Demonic species.
wiki_feat_ill_advised: Complete a Bioseed reset on a Hellscape planet while playing as any non-Demonic species.
wiki_feat_organ_harvester: Complete a Bioseed reset while playing as the Valdi species.
wiki_feat_the_misery: Complete a Black Hole/Vacuum Collapse/Ascension/Demonic Infusion/Terraforming reset while playing as the Valdi species.
wiki_feat_energetic: Complete an Ascension reset with 0 Thermal Collectors built.
wiki_feat_garbage_pie: Complete an Ascension/Demonic Infusion reset while playing as Valdi and never using A.R.P.A. Mutation to add or remove any Major or Genus traits.
wiki_feat_finish_line: Complete an Ascension/Demonic Infusion reset during the Cataclysm Scenario.
wiki_feat_blank_slate: Use A.R.P.A. Mutation to remove all Species and Genus traits.
wiki_feat_supermassive: Reach a black hole size of 100 Solar Masses, excluding any mass gained from the Asteroid Redirect A.R.P.A.
wiki_feat_steelem: Complete a Black Hole reset with the Steelen Challenge Mode active.
wiki_feat_banana: Using trade routes export 500 routes and import 500 routes worth of resources.
wiki_feat_rocky_road: Complete a Bioseed reset while playing on a planet that has at least three poor geology deposits.
wiki_feat_demon_slayer: Reach 666 million Demon Kills in a run.
wiki_feat_equilibrium: Fuse a Harmony Crystal into the Circle of Pillars with 50 unique species.
wiki_feat_digital_ascension: Ascend with the EM Field challenge active while playing unmodified Synth or Nano (no customs).
wiki_feat_grand_death_tour: Use distinct extinction events to kill the Ultra Sludge (Does not count in Micro).
wiki_feat_nephilim: Complete a Black Hole reset while playing in an Evil universe as any race in the Angelic genus.
wiki_feat_twisted: Complete a Demonic Infusion reset while playing as any race in the Angelic genus.
wiki_feat_slime_lord: Complete Demonic Infusion while playing as Sludge.
wiki_feat_annihilation: Create a matter replicator, in an antimatter universe.
wiki_feat_wish: Wish for greatness using the Wish spell and get lucky.
wiki_feat_friday: Play the game during a Friday the 13th.
wiki_feat_valentine: Play the game during Valentines Day.
wiki_feat_leprechaun: Play the game during Saint Patrick's Day.
wiki_feat_easter: Play the game during the Easter event period.
wiki_feat_egghunt: Find at least 12 hidden Eggs during the Easter event period.
wiki_feat_launch_day: Play the game during Launch Day (May 6th).
wiki_feat_solstice: Use Craftmen to create 1,000,000 total Thermite during the Solstice event (June 20th-22nd).
wiki_feat_firework: Watch some fireworks during the Firework Festival event.
wiki_feat_trickortreat: Find at least 12 total hidden Treats and hidden Ghosts during the Halloween event period.
wiki_feat_thanksgiving: Play the game during Thanksgiving day.
wiki_feat_xmas: Play the game during Christmas day.
wiki_feat_fool: During April Fools day, go to the Achievements tab and hover over the fake The Fool feat.
wiki_feat_immortal: Complete the Devilish Dish reset during the Fasting scenario without letting anyone starve.
wiki_structure_planetary_slaughter: Basic gathering option for Evil races; this replaces the other standard gathering methods.
wiki_structure_space_terraformer: Only available in Orbital Decay challenge.
wiki_structure_stardock_geck: Must be unlocked first by completing an advanced challenge called Orbital Decay.
wiki_structure_stardock_geck2: These can also be used during a Blackhole reset.
wiki_mechanics_save_para1: The game is automatically saved once per game day (%0 seconds).
wiki_mechanics_save_para2: Local Storage is used to save your game data, if you wipe out your browsers local storage you will lose your game progress.
wiki_mechanics_save_para3: You can also manually %0 your game state at any time from the settings tab.
wiki_mechanics_save_para4: It is highly recommended you make %0 saves to back up your game at regular intervals.
wiki_mechanics_save_para5: The %0 feature can also be used to revert your game to just prior to your last reset.
wiki_mechanics_save_para6: This is also stored in your browser's local storage and is no more secure than the active game data.
wiki_mechanics_save_para7: Do not attempt to treat it as a safe progress backup; exporting is best for that.
wiki_mechanics_save_para8: %0 merely lets you revert your game to just prior to your last reset in case you screw up your game somehow.
wiki_mechanics_atime_para1: If you pause the game or close the game window %0 is awarded.
wiki_mechanics_atime_para2: There must be at least a %0 minute pause before resuming, or no %1 is earned.
wiki_mechanics_atime_para3: The next time the game is resumed, it will run at %0 game speed until all the %1 is used.

wiki_mechanics_atime_para5: It takes %0 hours of stopped time to reach the %1 hour cap of %2.
wiki_mechanics_atime_para6: %0 does not carry over to the next run if a reset is used.
wiki_mechanics_spack_para1: String Packs are %0 encoded, %1 formatted %2 files that can be imported into the game.
wiki_mechanics_spack_para2: They can be used to change the strings used, allowing for textual customization of the game.
wiki_mechanics_spack_para3: String Packs can range from entirely retheming the game to simple micro-personalizations.
wiki_mechanics_spack_para4: The process of creating a String Pack is similar to that of creating a language file for the game, which is explained %0.
wiki_mechanics_spack_para5: Different from contributing a language, however, a String Pack can be called anything you want and isn't actually added to the base game, simply locally imported into your game client.
wiki_mechanics_spack_para6: For example, a String Pack that looks like this would rename %0 to %1 and %2 to %3.
wiki_mechanics_multiplier_para1: %0 can be used to enact most actions multiple times.
wiki_mechanics_multiplier_para2: There are %0 (%1), %2 (%3), and %4 (%5) keys and they can be combined for greater effect.
wiki_mechanics_multiplier_para3: The keys can be rebound on the settings tab.
wiki_mechanics_multiplier_para4: %0 work on just about anything that can be clicked except for manual resource gathering.
wiki_mechanics_multiplier_para5: If you think clicking something is repetitive, then you are doing it wrong; use the %0!
wiki_mechanics_job_para1: The %0 is the job that new population automatically fill by default.
wiki_mechanics_job_para2: It is denoted by the job with an %0 next to it.
wiki_mechanics_job_para3: You can change the %0 by clicking on another basic job.
wiki_mechanics_job_para4: Only the basic jobs can be set as the default job.
wiki_mechanics_job_para5: The default job acts as a staging ground for your population.
wiki_mechanics_job_para6: If a citizen dies, one is reassigned automatically from the default job to cover the loss.
wiki_mechanics_job_para7: If you lose more population than can be covered by those in the default job, then other jobs will start to suffer losses.
wiki_mechanics_job_para8: New citizens will then be auto-assigned away from the default job to replace those lost elsewhere; thus, the default job will be the last to recover.
wiki_mechanics_job_para9: If you are having problems managing your food supply, then it is a very bad idea to use farmers as the default job, since this ensures farmers will be the first job vacated.
wiki_mechanics_job_stress_para1: Job stress is a malus to morale generated by each working person in your civilization, providing a different amount of stress depending on the job they work in.
wiki_mechanics_job_stress_para2: Other than by making people %0 or getting rid of your population, the only way to actively reduce job stress is getting levels of the %1 minor trait.
wiki_mechanics_job_stress_para3: Each job type has its own %0, a value divided into %1 to calculate the amount of stress that each person assigned to that job generates.
wiki_mechanics_job_stress_para4: Stress divisors can be affected by a number of things, like the %0 trait, the %1 trait, %2 planets, and more.
wiki_mechanics_job_stress_para5: Differently from regular job types, the job stress generated by soldiers is linked to the current max number of soldiers rather than the number of soldiers alive.
wiki_mechanics_job_stress_para6: The %0 and %1 traits apply a flat bonus/malus to the %2 value reflected in the %3 tooltip, not individually impacting the job stress of any actual job.
wiki_mechanics_job_stress_para7: Some governments and %0 foreign powers apply overall multipiers to the total job stress generated by your people.
wiki_mechanics_cost_creep_para1: Cost creep is the number that the resource cost of a building is multiplied by for each constructed amount of that building, creating an exponential cost scaling.
wiki_mechanics_cost_creep_para2: If, for example, the %0 cost of a building starts at %1 and has a cost creep of %2, then after getting one of those buildings the next one will cost %3 %0, the one after that will cost %4 %0, and so on.
wiki_mechanics_cost_creep_para3: Buildings that can be purchased in theoretically unlimited amounts are affected by cost creep, as are %0 projects.
wiki_mechanics_cost_creep_para4: There are various traits, upgrades, and perks throughout the game that affect the cost creeps of many different buildings.
wiki_mechanics_cost_creep_para5: For example, the %0 tech reduces the cost creeps of some early-game housing buildings, the %1 trait increases the cost creeps of all homeworld structures, and the %2 %3 upgrades affect the cost creeps of all buildings.
wiki_mechanics_cost_creep_para6: While there are many things in the game that can affect the cost creep of buildings, only the %0 trait affects the cost creep of %1 projects.
wiki_mechanics_cost_creep_para7: The cost creep of any given building cannot fall below %0.
wiki_mechanics_queue_para1: %0 are a feature that is unlocked by researching %1.
wiki_mechanics_queue_para2: Once unlocked the %0 can be used to create a list of construction projects which will automatically be constructed once the resources are available.
wiki_mechanics_queue_para3: Items in the building queue will be constructed in order.
wiki_mechanics_queue_para4: A %0 can be unlocked later with a tech called %1.

wiki_mechanics_queue_para7: You can add an item to the queue which is currently purchasable by holding the %0 (%1).
wiki_mechanics_queue_para8: The %0 requires being enabled on the settings tab and can also be remapped there.
wiki_mechanics_queue_para9: The queue can be reordered simply by dragging the queued items in the list.
wiki_mechanics_queue_para10: The queue behavior can also be changed on the settings tab using the %0 option to build anything that is affordable instead of building in order.

wiki_mechanics_queue_para12: Through changing the %0 setting, this behavior can be changed to either never merge items or to always merge items regardless of their position in the queue.
wiki_mechanics_queue_para13: Each queue can be paused/played by toggling the pause/play buttons next to the queue counters, which when paused will stop them from building/researching anything queued until resumed.
wiki_mechanics_multipliers_para1: Structures that affect the game by a percentage value generally fall into 2 categories: Production or Discounting.
wiki_mechanics_multipliers_prod_para1: Production structures are those which increase a value and typically stack additively with each other.
wiki_mechanics_multipliers_prod_para2: An additively stacking bonus works by a simple forumla of:
wiki_mechanics_multipliers_prod_para4: A Powered Mine, for example, boosts Miner production by 5%, so owning 2 will give a total bonus of 10%, and 20 mines a total bonus of 100%.
wiki_mechanics_multipliers_dis_para1: Discounting structures are those which decrease a value and are applied multiplicatively with each other.
wiki_mechanics_multipliers_dis_para2: A multiplicatively stacking bonus generally works by the formula:
wiki_mechanics_multipliers_dis_para4: These kinds of bonuses are typically applied to make something cheaper.
wiki_mechanics_multipliers_dis_para5: The %0 for example decreases fuel costs.
wiki_mechanics_multipliers_dis_para6: If a fuel cost has a base value of %0 and each %1 discounts that cost by %2, then 1 %1 will lower the cost to %3 and 20 %1 will lower the cost to %4.
wiki_mechanics_multipliers_dis_para7: The cost would not become free, since %0 * %1 ^ %2 = %3.
wiki_mechanics_multipliers_exception: Exceptions may apply to these rules, but are usually stated if they work in an unusual way.
wiki_mechanics_blocking_para1: When a building has resources which you currently have insufficant quantity of, it will show which resources you lack using a color-coded system.
wiki_mechanics_blocking_para2: With the default game theme (Gruvbox Dark), the resource that will take the longest to get the required amount of will show up in %0.
wiki_mechanics_blocking_para3: Other resouces you currently have insufficant quantity of will be displayed in %0.
wiki_mechanics_blocking_para4: If you queue a stack of structures for construction and the blocking resource on the first in the stack is different from the last one in the stack, a gradient effect will be used to show this.
wiki_mechanics_blocking_para5: In this case the blocking resource with the longest time to acquire for the first in the stack will be shown with %0 on the left, and the resource which will take the longest to acquire to complete the entire stack will be shown in %0 on the right.

wiki_governor_intro_para1: Governors can be appointed after unlocking the CRISPR tech %0.

wiki_governor_task_para1: The main function of a governor is the ability to assign them tasks which they do on your behalf.

wiki_governor_task_storage1: The Crate Constructor will automatically build crates or containers.
wiki_governor_task_storage2: This does not assign them to resources, but merely keeps you topped off on available crates/containers.
wiki_governor_task_bal_storage1: The Crate Manager will automatically assign crates and containers to resources.
wiki_governor_task_bal_storage2: It will attempt to distribute them evenly, except for Coal and Food which have special rules.

wiki_governor_task_spy1: The Spy Recruiter will automatically use excess funds to buy replacement spies.

wiki_governor_task_mech2: It will attempt to field a wide variety of mech classes, weapons, chassis, and equipment to hedge your bets against any floor type.
wiki_governor_task_mech3: It will not scrap mechs or attempt to optimize them for the current floor, but instead try to build an assortment of mechs that are effective on average.

wiki_combat_basics_para1: Once you build a barracks and get some soldiers, you can attack rival cities for resources.
wiki_combat_basics_para2: To initiate an attack, go to the civics tab and manage your army. There is also a special military tab that shows all military information.
wiki_combat_basics_para3: Assign soldiers to your battalion to use them in an attack campaign.
wiki_combat_basics_para4: Pick a type of campaign to wage, and then pick a target and press Attack to steal resources from that rival city.
wiki_combat_campaign_para1: There are %0 different types of war campaigns: %1, %2, %3, %4, and %5.
wiki_combat_campaign_para2: When you attack a rival there is a chance of success or failure, depending on the campaign type and the military strength of your chosen target.
wiki_combat_campaign_para3: %0 is the easiest campaign type, having the lowest risk but also the lowest payoff. As you progress to harder campaign types, the risk increases but so do the rewards.
wiki_combat_campaign_para4: %0 is the hardest campaign type, having the most risk but also the largest payoff. It also offers an opportunity to occupy an enemy city if at least %1 of your soldiers survive the battle.
wiki_combat_campaign_para5: Every soldier you commit to the battle has a chance to be wounded or killed.
wiki_combat_campaign_para6: If you send wounded soldiers into battle, they have a very high chance to die.
wiki_combat_campaign_para7: Healthy soldiers will be committed to battle before wounded soldiers, but if you do not have enough healthy soldiers to fill your battalion, then wounded soldiers will be sent into battle.
wiki_combat_campaign_para8: You should allow your soldiers time to heal rather than sending wounded soldiers into battle, as this will almost always result in high casualties.
wiki_combat_campaign_para9: Overcommitting soldiers to an offensive action is also a mistake, as this increases the number of soldiers that can be wounded or die in a single attack action.
wiki_combat_campaign_para10: You should never send max soldiers into combat unless you need them to win; always use the smallest battalion size that gets you a good win rate.
wiki_combat_campaign_para11: A %0 advantage is a %1 chance to win.
wiki_combat_campaign_para12: The advantage/disadvantage rating is how far above or below the %0/%0 win/loss rate you are.
wiki_combat_campaign_para13: Typically you want to aim for around %0 advantage; no advantage no matter how big will guarantee you a %1 win rate, but a nice advantage will cause you to win an overwhelming amount of the time.
wiki_combat_campaign_para14: If your combat advantage is above %0, then you should consider lowering your battalion size to reduce casualties.
